description: Juventus will be looking to kick off new Serie A campaign in style when they take on Chievo at Stadio Marc’Antonio Bentegodi on Saturday evening. Cristiano Ronaldo is eager to prove his worth on his Juve debut and, no doubt, all eyes will be on the start of the summer transfer window when the Bianconeri take on the Mussi Volanti on the opening day of the season. Max Allegri’s men are likely to adopt an attack-minded approach against Chievo and we predict that they are going to emerge triumphant in Saturday’s football game. The Mussi Volanti experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a heavy 5-0 loss to Hoffenheim in their final warm-up game, which is yet another reason why away win should be considered. In their last meeting in the “City of Love” Juventus recorded a 2-0 win over Chievo and the history is likely to repeat itself.

All eyes will be on Stadio Olimpico when Lazio and Napoli take on each other in the opening match of the season. The Biancocelesti missed out on a place in the Champions League in the last season finale, but they are going to represent Italy in the Europa League in the 2018/2019 season. Lazio chiefs did well to keep hold of key midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, who is likely to pose a big threat for Napoli defenders in Saturday’s football match. The Neapolitans are determined to put an end to Juventus’ dominance in the Serie A, but seeing that Cristiano Ronaldo joined the title holders in the summer transfer window, that is easier said than done. Anyhow, Napoli are likely to stick to their attacking style of play against Lazio, which is the main reason why we predict both sides are going to find the net at Stadio Olimpico.

Empoli and Cagliari face each other at Stadio Carlo Castellani in the opening match of the season. Empoli return to the Italian top flight after spending only one season in the Serie B and, no doubt, they can’t wait for Sunday’s football match against Cagliari to start. The Azzurri produce much better showings at home ground than on the travels, but seeing that they suffered a heavy 3-0 loss to Cittadella at their Stadio Carlo Castellani in the Italian Cup clash at the weekend, we do not believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. Over the years Cagliari have established themselves as a mid-table side in the Serie A and they are definitely capable of grabbing something from the opening match of the season. Seeing that the Rossoblu are not regarded as good travelers, we predict the two teams will share the spoils on day 1 of the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign.

Torino and Roma take on each other at Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of the opening day of the season. Il Toro head into Sunday’s football match following a routine win over Cosenca in Coppa Italia and they are surely high on confidence ahead of the visit of Roma. Belotti, who has established himself as one of the best attackers in the Italian top flight, is likely to lead the line for the hosts against the Giallorossi. Roma aim to bounce back from a 2-1 loss to Real Madrid in their final warm-up game, but beating Torino on the road is easier said than done. Over the years Il Toro have turned their Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino into a real fortress and despite the fact that Roma will represent Italy in the Champions League this term, we believe that there is a big value in betting on draw.

Following a three-year absence Parma return to Serie A. The Gli Emiliani failed to win last six games in the Italian top flight and, no doubt, they are eager to give fans some cheer. Parma aim to bounce back from a 1-0 loss to Pisa in the Coppa Italia and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at Udinese when the two teams face each other at Ennio Tardini. A man to watch in the home team will be Jonathan Biabiany, who returned to the club earlier this summer. Udinese, on the other hand, aim to make amends for the unsuccessful 2017/2018 Serie A campaign and given Parma’s lack of experience in the elite division, we are tempted to put our money on the visitors. Venezuela attacker Darwin Machis, who joined the Zebrette in the summer transfer window, is likely to make his Udinese debut against Parma. Anyhow, a close encounter is on the cards.

Inter have big ambitions for the 2018/2019 season. The Nerazzurri aim to play an important role in both Serie A and the Champions League and there is every chance they will adopt an attack-minded approach in the opener against Sassuolo. Mauro Icardi, who scored 29 goals in the Serie A last term, will be the man to watch in the away team, whereas Belgium international Nainggolan is likely to make his Inter debut against Sassuolo. The Neroverdi are eager to shock the Nerazzurri in the opening match of the season and seeing that they outclassed Ternana 5-1 in Coppa Italia at the weekend, we believe that the hosts are going to grab something from Sunday’s football match. An entertaining clash is on the horizon and we believe the two teams are going to play out a high-scoring draw at Mapei Stadium – Citta del Tricolore.

Bologna play host to SPAL at their Stadio Renato Dall’Ara in the opening game of the season. The Rossoblu recorded a routine 2-0 win over Padova in the Coppa Italia at the weekend and they will be looking to build on the triumph when they take on SPAL in their Serie A opener. Switzerland international Dzemaili, who found the net in the 2-0 win over Padova, will be one of the men to watch in the home team. It is well known that Bologna are tough to beat at home, but the visitors should not be written off just yet. SPAL were producing thrilling displays in the second half of the 2017/2018 Serie A campaign and, as a result, they secured the survival. SPAL and Bologna seem to be evenly matched ahead of the start of the new season and we predict that they are going to share the spoils at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara.

Atalanta will be aiming to kick off the new Serie A campaign in style when they host Frosinone at their Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia on Monday evening. Over the years the Orobici have established themselves as a top-table side in the Italian top flight and it is no surprise they are seen as hot favourites to win the season opener against Frosinone. Atalanta have been scoring goals for fun in the Europa League qualifiers this term and we predict that they are going to prove their worth on the field. Frosinone, on the other hand, experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 3-1 loss to Real Betis in their last warm-up game and, to make things even worse for the fans, they were beaten by Suditrol in their Coppa Italia opener at the weekend. David faces Goliath in Bergamo and, taking everything into account, we do not believe Frosinone are going to spoil Atalanta’s party at Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia.

Juventus were on the verge of sharing the spoils with Chievo in Verona in their opener, but thanks to Federico Bernardeschi’s goal in the stoppage time the title holders picked up all three points from the match. Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score on his Juve debut, but, no doubt, all eyes will be on CR7 when the Bianconeri take on Lazio at their Allianz Stadium on Saturday. The Biancocelesti suffered a 2-1 loss to Napoli at their Stadio Olimpico in the opening match of the season, meaning that they would be more than happy with one point from Saturday’s football game. However, seeing that Cristiano Ronaldo is eager to prove his worth in his first game at Allianz Stadium, we predict that the defending champions are going to beat the capital club in Turin.

All eyes will be on Stadio San Paolo when Napoli and Milan square off against each other in the Serie A derby. The Neapolitans came from behind to beat Lazio in the “Eternal City”, meaning that they are high on confidence ahead of Saturday’s football match against the Rossoneri. Maurizio Sarri is no longer in charge of the team, but Carlo Ancelotti is undisputedly capable of recording a good result with Napoli in the 2018/2019 season. The Partenopei have turned their Stadio San Paolo into a real fortress and despite the fact that Gonzalo Higuain will play for Milan this time out, home win should be considered. The Rossoneri’s game against Genoa was postponed at the weekend and, no doubt, Genaro Gattuso’s men will give 100% in order to grab something from the opening match of the season. Anyhow, Napoli, who defeated Milan 2-1 in their last meeting in Naples, are widely expected to win Saturday’s clash.

Despite creating several clear-cut chances to score against SPAL, Bologna eventually failed to grab something from the opening match of the season. The Rossoblu deserved to pick up at least one point from their opener, but they will have a chance to get back on course on Sunday as they take on newcomers Frosinone at Stadio Benito Stirpe. Bologna produced a fine display in the 1-0 loss to SPAL and that is the main reason why we predict they are going to beat Frosinone on Matchday 2. The Canarini are determined to give fans some cheer on their return to the Italian top flight, but seeing that they were struggling in both pre-season and Coppa Italia game against Suditrol, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the visitors. In their last meeting in the Serie A Frosinone emerge triumphant, meaning that Bologna are hungry for revenge.

Buoyed by a thrilling 4-0 win over Lecce in the Coppa Italia, Genoa take on Empoli at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris in their first game of the new Serie A campaign. The Rossoblu were not into action at the weekend as their game against Milan was postponed, whereas Empoli recorded a 2-0 win over Cagliari on their return to the Italian top flight. The newcomers are a real force to be reckoned with at home, but they often struggle on the travels, which is the main reason why we are tempted to put our money on Genoa. The Rossoblu have turned their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris into a real fortress, therefore, we predict that the hosts are going to emerge triumphant in Sunday’s football match. A man to watch in the home team will be summer signing Piatek, who scored four goals in the victory over Lecce.

Stadio Paolo Mazza will host Sunday’s football game between SPAL and Parma. SPAL did remarkably well to beat Bologna on the road in the opening match of the season, whereas Parma shared the spoils with Udinese in their opener. The newcomers dropped a two-goal advantage in the 2-2 draw with the Zebrette, but they showed everybody that they are capable of producing fine performances in the Italian top flight. SPAL were impressive at home ground in the last season finale and they are definitely capable of grabbing something from their first home game of the season. Anyhow, a close encounter is on the horizon and we predict the two teams are going to share the spoils at Stadio Paolo Mazza. You should bear in mind that the two teams meet for the first time ever in the Italian top flight.

Cagliari will be aiming to make amends for a 2-0 loss to Empoli when they host Sassuolo at their Sardegna Arena on Sunday evening. The Rossoblu are determined to get back on course as quickly as possible and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at the Neroverdi on day 2 of the new Serie A campaign. However, they will have a big fish to fry in Sunday’s football match against Sassuolo as the visitors defeated Inter in the opening game of the season. The Neroverdi aim to give fans yet another reason for celebration and seeing that Cagliari experience all sorts of problems at the back in the defeat to Empoli, away win should be considered. Considering that the hosts are likely to adopt an attack-minded approach in the Sardegna Arena clash, we are positive that the visitors will have a number of opportunities to score on the break.

Dacia Arena will host Sunday’s football game between Udinese and Sampdoria. The Zebrette did well to come from two goals behind and share the spoils with Parma in their opener, whilst Sampdoria’s game against was postponed. Udinese were having their ups and downs in the 2017/2018 Serie A season and, no doubt, they want to record a good result in the Italian top flight this term. La Samp were producing fine performances in pre-season and that is probably the main reason why we predict the visitors are going to grab something from Sunday’s clash. Fabio Quagliarella is still part of the team and we believe that he is going to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. Anyhow, share of spoils appears on the horizon in this one as the two teams seem to be evenly matched at the moment.

Fiorentina were not into action at the weekend as their match against Sampdoria at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris was postponed. The Viola can’t wait for their Serie A campaign to begin and we predict that they are going to fight tooth and nail against Chievo when the two teams face each other at Stadio Artemio Franchi this weekend. It is well known that Fiorentina produce much better performances at home than on the travels and despite the fact that the Mussi Volanti made life difficult for Juve in their opener, we are tempted to put our money on Stefano Pioli’s troops. Chievo recorded only one win previous 15 away games in the Italian top flight, which is yet another reason why the visitors are likely to return home empty-handed from the trip to Florence. In their last meeting in the Serie A Fiorentina recorded a hard-fought 1-0 win over Chievo.

Inter will be aiming to bounce back from a 1-0 loss to Sassuolo when they host Torino at their Stadio Giuseppe Meazza. The club chiefs did well to reinforce the squad in the summer transfer window, but that did not help them grab something from the opening game of the season. Luciano Spalletti’s troops are eager to return to winning ways and we predict that they are going to adopt an attack-minded approach in Sunday’s football game. Il Toro, on the other hand, suffered a 1-0 loss to Roma in front of home fans, with Edin Dzeko scoring the winner for the Gialorossi in the dying minutes of the match. Torino are not regarded as good travelers and seeing that Inter coach Luciano Spalletti is going to field the best possible side this time out, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the Nerazzurri.

Thanks to Edin Dzeko’s late goal Roma defeated Torino on the road in the opening match of the season. The Giallorossi are brimming with confidence ahead of their first home game of the season, but Monday’s football match against Atalanta will be anything but a walk in the park for the capital club. Roma have big ambitions for the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at the Orobici on Monday evening. Atalanta are not regarded as good travelers, but seeing that they have been scoring goals for fun in the Europa League qualifiers, we believe that the visitors are going to grab something from the Roma showdown. A lively contest is on the horizon and, taking everything into account, we believe that the two teams are going to play out a high-scoring draw at Stadio Olimpico.

After the Week 1 game was cancelled, Milan played Napoli in Week 2 and were defeated by a result of 3:2 after being 2:0 up. On the other hand, Roma have won their opening game against Torino 1:0 and are expecting a tough game against Atalanta, in the last match of Round 2. AC Milan have strengthened their squad with the arrivals of Higuaín, Calhanoglu, Silva and Rodriguez. Higuaín will try to cement his place in the team after being the casualty of Juventus signing Ronaldo. The biggest departures from Roma were their goalkeeper Alisson who went to Liverpool, together with Nainggolan who went to Inter. They brought in Nzonzi from Sevilla and a couple of other players. The biggest threat from Roma will still be Edin Dzeko while Milan will attack with Higuaín on top. It will be a tight match, with the Rossoneri looking to change tactics after they fell to Napoli. We predict a score draw.

Parma have just been promoted from Serie B. In their first match back they drew with Udinese only to lose to SPAL in their second match of the season. Juventus have started strongly, as it was expected of them after signing Cristiano Ronaldo from Real Madrid in the most talked about transfer of this year. They managed to defeat Chievo after going 2:1 down and then Lazio in Week 2, with a 2:0 score with Ronaldo getting his first assist. Generally, Juventus has had a lot of success against Parma over the years. The last time Juve were defeated by Parma was in 2011. Fans will fill the seats at the Il Tardini stadium to watch Ronaldo play against their team. Parma won’t be able to hold back Juventus and is likely to lose again this season. Juventus is a sure favourite for this match; it’s just a question of what will be the final score.

Inter Milan, one of the teams who brought in a lot of new players this season, went down to a shocking defeat against Sassuolo, losing 1:0. In their next game, they drew 2:2 with Torino. Now they are looking for a much improved performance against hosts Bologna at the Renato Dall’ara stadium. Coach Spalletti will probably shake up his Inter team. Bologna have lost their opening match against SPAL and then played out a goalless draw with the newcomers Forsinone. Both teams have started in bad form and will look to correct that in this match. Sime Vrsaljko might be a feature after not playing in the first game as Spalletti will look to shore up the defence. Bologna will miss Nagy after his red card. The last time Bologna defeated Inter was in 2013. Inter has an excellent head to head record against Bologna. We predict for Inter to get their first win of the season.

Sassuolo became a sensation in Italy after their shock victory over Inter Milan in their opening match of the 2018/19 season. Showing everyone it wasn’t luck, they got a point away in Cagliari in their second game. Genoa was supposed to play AC Milan in their opening game which was cancelled. In week 2 of the season, they played host to the promoted Empoli and won 2:1. Now they go to Reggio nell’Emilia, to the Citta del Tricolore stadium where they are sure to get an energized reception by the Sassuolo home fans. Both Genoa forwards, Piatek and Kouame scored against Empoli and they will surely be leading the attack against Sassuolo. They, on the other hand, will have Berardi up front, who has managed to score in both of the opening matches of the season. Genoa are favourites, but it will be a tough game and we predict a score draw.

Sampdoria didn’t play their first match of the season because of the cancellation and have lost to Udinese in the second game. For their opening match, Napoli beat Lazio 2:1. In week 2, they came back from two goals down to beat AC Milan 3:2, in what was also the first match Carlo Ancelotti coached against his old team. While it’s still early days, things are looking good for Napoli. Sampdoria didn’t impress in their one and only game this season, but now they are back at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris, they might perform better in front of the home crowd and surprise their opponents. But they will have to work hard and overcome a trend of Napoli beating them. The last time Sampdoria defeated Napoli was in the last game of the 2009/10 season. The key player for Sampdoria will be Quagliarella who will try to lead his team to victory. Still, we predict an away win.

Chievo couldn’t have had a tougher schedule in the first two weeks of the new season and they couldn’t had the worse results, after losing two games and already conceding eight goals. Thankfully, they now have an easier game, at least on paper, against Empoli, who have been promoted from Serie B this year. In reality though, Empoli already have one win under their belt, since they beat Cagliari 2:0 in their opening match. Now, they will be looking to add a further blow to Chievo at their own Marc’Antonio Bentegodi Stadium in Verona. Both sides will be highly motivated to win which should make for an interesting game. The key players for Chievo will be the squad captain Radovanovic and the three attackers, Birsa, Stepinski and Giaccherini. Empoli will look for some magic from their captain and main forward, Caputo. It’s one of those games that could go both ways but we predict a first victory for Chievo this season.

Atalanta started with a statement in their first match of the season by comprehensively beating the newly promoted Frosinone side 4:0. In their Week 2 match, they play Roma and after that Cagliari. Cagliari started this year’s Scudetto by losing 2:0 to Empoli, promoted from Serie B. They did better in the second match narrowly missing out on a win after Sassuolo scored in the ninth minute of time added on. These two teams will be evenly match when the match kicks-off at the Atleti Azzurri d’Italia Stadium. In their previous eight encounters they split the honours with each winning four times. So it’s not likely the game will finish tied, as the last time that happened was in 2013. Cagliari will have a chance as Atalanta will have to battle for the Europa League spot against FC Copenhagen on Thursday, just three days before the Scudetto game.

The Stadio Olimpico in Rome will play host to a match between Frosinone, who earned promotion from Serie B and Lazio, who had a tough two games. First they played last season’s runners-up, Napoli, scored first but lost 2:1 in the end. In their second game they went against the Scudetto Champions from last year, Juventus and lost 2:0. Some might say that they have done well to only concede four goals. Frosinone played Atalanta in their first game back and were heavily defeated 4:0. The week after they managed to get a point with a goalless draw against Bologna. Now they go to Lazio who will look to take their frustrations out on someone. One of the key players for Lazio will be Milinkovic-Savic who’s been the centre of this summer’s transfer rumours in Rome but nothing panned out in the end. Immobile has got one for Lazio against Napoli and will want to carry on scoring against Frosinone.

Fiorentina didn’t play their week 1 game against Sampdoria because the game was cancelled and postponed to a later date. In Week 2 of the Scudetto, Fiorentina demolished Chievo scoring six goals in the process. Udinese drew with Parma in the opening match and narrowly beat Sampdoria in the second match of the season. Neither team played exceptionally well in their pre-season games. Fiorentina will use the support of their home fans at the Artemio Franchi stadium to beat the tough Udinese side. They have Champions League ambitions and Coach Pioli will be happy if they continue their performance against Udinese. However, Udinese Coach Velazguez is bound to have other ideas. Even though he was happy with the win against Sampdoria, he will look to make changes to find out what his best first eleven are, led of course by their captain Valon Behrami. Still, we predict a narrow Fiorentina win.

Last year they have done well not get relegated from Serie A, but SPAL have started this year with a bang. First they defeated Bologna away 1:0 and in the second game Parma at home, also with a 1:0 score. Torino conceded a late goal to lose against Roma 1:0 in the opening game, but they battled to secure a point against Inter in the second game, after going 2:0 down in the first half. This match sees them welcome SPAL to the Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. While they are overjoyed with six points, SPAL coach, Leonardo Semplici remains humble and knows that the main target this season is survival in Serie A. Torino finished 9th last year and if they are to do better this year, they must beat sides like SPAL, home and away. European football is a great incentive for the team. We predict a home win.

As expected, Frosinone were beaten by Lazio at Stadio Olimpico on day 3 of the new Serie A campaign. The newcomers have been struggling at the start of the season, with the team failing to find the net in the first three league fixtures. The Canarini are eager to give fans some cheer, but they will have a big fish to fry in Saturday’s football match against Sampdoria, who rolled over star-studded Napoli in their last league match. La Samp proved their worth in the triumph over the Partenopei, with Gregoire Defrel scoring a brace and we predict that the French attacker is going to lead the visitors to yet another triumph. Frosinone do not seem to be on top of their game ahead of the visit of Sampdoria and there is every chance Marco Giampaolo’s men will record their second win of the season.

All eyes will be on Stadio San Paolo when Napoli take on Fiorentina on day 4 of the new Serie A campaign. Napoli aim to bounce back from a heavy 3-0 defeat to Sampdoria, but Saturday’s football match against Fiorentina will be anything but a walk in the park for the Partenopei. Carlo Ancelotti’s troops are likely to leave their hearts on the field and we believe that they are going to find the net on Matchday 4. The Viola, on the other hand, aim to keep their 100% record intact and they are likely to stick to their attacking style of play against Napoli. A lively contest is on the cards and we predict that the two teams are going to play out a high-scoring draw in Naples. You should bear in mind, though, that the two teams played out a goalless draw in their last meeting at Stadio San Paolo.

Inter will be aiming to build on a 3-0 win over Bologna when they host Parma at their Stadio Giuseppe Meazza on Saturday afternoon. The Nerazzurri have been scoring goals for fun at the start of the season and there is every chance they will go all guns blazing at the newcomer on Matchday 4. Mauro Icardi wants to continue where he left last season and, no doubt, he will give 100% to open his goal-scoring account this weekend. Inter are a real force to be reckoned with at home and considering that the newcomers have been struggling at the back at the start of the season, we are tempted to put our money on the Nerazzurri. Yet another man to watch in the home team will be Ivan Perisic, who impressed at the 2018 FIFA World Cup finals, helping Croatia make it to the final of the showpiece tournament.

Udinese and Torino face each other at Dacia Arena in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Sunday’s program in the Serie A. Udinese aim to bounce back from a 1-0 loss to Fiorentina and the fact that they defeated Sampdoria in their first home game of the season is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the visit of Torino. Il Toro, on the other hand, head into the game following a hard-fought 1-0 win over SPAL, but seeing that their away record in the Serie A is anything but good, we do not believe that there is a big value in betting on the visitors. As previously mentioned, a lively contest is on the horizon and we predict that both teams to score bet should be considered. In their last meeting at Dacia Arena Il Toro recorded a 3-2 win over the Zebrette.

Despite the fact that Cristiano Ronaldo has yet to open his goal-scoring account, Juventus made a flying start to the season. The Bianconeri recorded a win in each of their first three league fixtures and the title holders will be looking to keep their 100% record intact when they host Sassuolo at their Allianz Stadium. Juve are a real force to be reckoned with at home and seeing that CR7 is eager to score his first ever goal in the Serie A, we predict that Max Allegri’s troops are going to pick up all three points from Sunday’s football match. The Neroverdi, on the other hand, have been scoring goals for fun at the start of the season, with the team rolling over Genoa 5-3 in their last league fixture. Sassuolo, though, often struggle on the travels, which is yet another reason why we are tempted to put our money on the Bianconeri.

Cagliari will be aiming to build on a hard-fought 1-0 win over Atalanta when they face yet another star-studded team in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign. The Rossoblu play host to Milan at their Sardegna Arena on Matchday 4 and, no doubt, they would be happy with one point from Sunday’s football match. Cagliari are brimming with confidence ahead of the visit of the Rossoneri and seeing that they are a real force to be reckoned with at home, we believe that they are going to extend their unbeaten run in the Italian top flight to three games. Thanks to Cutrone’s late goal Milan defeated Roma in the Serie A derby, but seeing that the Rossoneri often struggle on the travels, we are tempted to put our money on the underdogs. A man to watch in the home team will be Leonardo Pavoletti, who has netted two goals in the new Serie A campaign to date.

Roma will be aiming to make amends to a 2-1 loss to Milan when they take on Chievo at their Stadio Olimpico. The Romans were more than unfortunate not to grab something from the Milan clash as the Rossoneri scored the winner in the stoppage time, but the Giallorossi should now focus on Sunday’s match against Chievo. It is well known that Roma have turned their Stadio Olimpico into a real fortress and seeing that the Mussi Volanti experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 6-1 loss to Fiorentina, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. In their last meeting in the “eternal city” Roma crushed Chievo 4-1 and we predict that the history is going to repeat itself. As always, Bosnia international Edin Dzeko will lead the line for the capital club.

Genoa and Bologna take on each other at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris on day 4 of the new Serie A campaign. Genoa experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 5-3 loss to Sassuolo, but the fact that they defeated Empoli in their first home game of the season is certainly giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of Sunday’s football match. Davide Ballardini’s men produce much better showings at home than on the travels and seeing that Bologna have yet to find the net in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign, we believe that home win should be considered. A man to watch in the home team will be Krzysztof Piatek, who has already netted three goals in the new season. Taking everything into account, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts.

Stadio Carlo Castellani will host Sunday’s football game between Empoli and Lazio, who have different ambitions for the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign. Empoli are eager to secure the Serie A survival, whilst Lazio, who managed to keep hold of Serbian superstar Sergej Milinkovic-Savic, are eyeing a place in the Champions League. The newcomers have been producing fine performances at the start of the season, with the team collecting four points from possible nine. The Azzurri are tough to beat at home and, no doubt, the Biancocelesti face a difficult task in Sunday’s clash. The capital club have been struggling to find their best form at the start of the season and that is probably the main reason why we predict the two teams are going to share the spoils at Stadio Carlo Castellani. It has to be noted that under 2.5 goals were scored in three of their last four meetings in the Italian top flight.

Atalanta will be aiming to bounce back from a shocking 1-0 loss to Cagliari when they take on SPAL at Stadio Paolo Mazza on Monday evening. SPAL made a flying start to the season, but following back-to-back wins over Bologna and Parma, they suffered a 1-0 loss to Torino in their last league match. Leonardo Semplici’s troops are tough to beat at home, but Atalanta are likely to pose a much bigger threat for the hosts than their previous rivals. The Orobici are determined to return to winning ways following the unexpected defeat to Cagliari and we predict that the visitors are going to prove their worth on the field. As always, a man to watch in the away team will be Argentine midfielder Alejandro Gomez, who is eager to add more goals to his account after scoring a brace in the 4-0 win over Frosinone.

The postponed Serie A match between high-flying Sampdoria and Fiorentina takes place on Wednesday, with both sides looking to build on a promising start to the season and climb to second in the overall standings with three points from the midweek match. The Blucerchiati recovered well from the opening defeat to Udinese, going on to record 3-0 and 5-0 wins over Napoli and Frosinone, so there are no doubts they are high on confidence at the moment. Fiorentina, on the other hand, hammered Chievo 6-1 before narrowly defeating Udinese, but their winning run came to an end in Naples as they suffered a narrow loss. With both sides in excellent spirit after their respective bright starts, we expect to see an open game at Marassi, where the two evenly matched sides are likely to end up canceling each other out.

After four rounds of the 2018/19 season in Serie A, Sassuolo are sitting in third place, just behind Juventus and Napoli. Empoli, however, are in the bottom part of the table. The newly promoted Empoli side is struggling after they managed to score a win in their first game back in Serie A. Sassuolo finished 11th last year and will be looking to improve on that result. So far this season, they recorded a surprise Round One win against Inter Milan, drew with Cagliari and scored five goals in a win over Genoa, before losing to Juventus this past weekend. After scoring twice against Cagliari in the opening match of the season, Empoli have struggled in front of goal, scoring only once in the last three matches. In their previous 17 matches, Sassuolo hold the upper hand with nine wins and they are clear favorites to get another one on the board, securing all three points at home.

After going down in a shock defeat to Sassuolo in the opening match of the season, Inter had another shocking defeat at home, against the newly promoted Parma this time. Things are not progressing as planned this season, as the Nerazzurri are sitting down in 15th place with only four points from four matches. Their only win this season came against Bologna in round three. And with only five goals scored so far, they are averaging just over a goal per game. Sampdoria have only played in three games so far, and they will meet Fiorentina in midweek before they welcome the Milan team. After losing their opening match without scoring, the Blucerchiati managed to win the next two games, scoring three goals against 2nd placed Napoli and five goals against the 19th placed Frosinone. Inter will look to bounce back but Sampdoria might be too hot for them right now. We predict a home win.

The venue for this bottom half of the table match between Parma and Cagliari will be the Ennio Tardini Stadium in Parma. Cagliari are currently in 12th position with five points while Parma are 17th with one point less. Parma started the season badly, losing two games and drawing one. However, they managed to spring a surprise on Inter in their last game, beating them 1:0 away. Cagliari have lost their opening match of the season against Empoli, but have since been better, recording a win against Atalanta and draws against Sassuolo and AC Milan. Cagliari are hoping not to fight to stay in Serie A this year and to finish higher than 16th place. Parma finished just behind Empoli in Serie B last year and are finding their way in Serie A this season. Both teams need the win to give them confidence for the rest of the season. A draw is the most likely outcome.

Both Fiorentina and SPAL have only played three matches so far. SPAL takes on Atalanta in the last game of round four. Fiorentina is going to Sampdoria midweek to play in a game that was postponed in August. Both will hope for good results going into this matchup on Saturday, at the Artemio Franchi Stadium. They have met 34 times in their history, with Fiorentina taking 14 wins as opposed to seven wins from SPAL. Fiorentina just missed out on Europe last year, while SPAL struggled to stay up and finished in 17th place. This year, their form is identical. They are sitting next to each other in the table, 5th and 6th, with Fiorentina on top because of a much better goal difference. In fact, SPAL have really struggled to get goals this season. Both of their wins have ended with a 1:0 score. The Viola have scored seven goals so far compared to SPAL’s two goals. Should be close home win.

In this early Sunday kick-off at the Olimpico di Torino, the Torino team will host the number two team in Serie A, Napoli. The home side started the 2018 campaign with a defeat to Roma but haven’t lost in the last three games, recording a win and two draws giving them five points in the table at the moment. Napoli have three wins and a defeat to Sampdoria at the start of September. So far, they’ve beaten Fiorentina, AC Milan and Lazio. They have a tough away game after playing in the Champions League during the week. The last two encounters between the il' Torro and the Azzurri finished all square, with no goals. In the past two years, Napoli have been more successful with Torino’s last win back in 2016. Napoli will want to win some points in a tough away game, while Torino will want to carry on with their undefeated run of three matches.

Stadio Benito Stirpe will see a real David and Goliath battle in the last match of Round 4 of the 2018/19 Serie A season. Juventus, the number one team in the table and still undefeated are coming to town together with Cristiano Ronaldo who has just scored his first two goals for the Old Lady. Frosinone are sitting in the bottom three teams in the table with just a single point from four games. Still, they will have some home that they might snatch a point since the last match between the two sides, out of four in total they ever played in, finished with a score of 1:1. Juventus might even bring in a changed side because they will be playing in the Champions League during the week. The current Champs are still to come across one of the stronger teams in Serie A but you can only beat who’s in front of you. That will be the case with Frosinone too.

AC Milan drew with Cagliari in their last game which wasn’t a favorable result but there was one positive as Higuain scored his first goal for the club since he came from Juventus. Atalanta will take on SPAL before the game at the San Siro stadium. Last year AC Milan and Atalanta finished the season next to each other in the table , 6th and 7th. This year, they are also next to each other in the table but in 13th and 14th place, neither team starting the season well. Milan has one game less than Atalanta, but that postponed game will be played before the end of the month. In fact Milan is playing in four matches until the end of September, with the postponed game and Europa League. In the 32 head to head matches so far, Milan have won 13 and Atalanta nine matches. Milan should edge this one too.

Bologna are currently sitting in the relegation zone still waiting for their first win of the season. Roma are languishing in the middle of the table with five points from one victory and two draws so far, with the only victory coming from their opening match of the 2018/19 Serie A season. The Giallorossi have been struggling to keep the ball going into their net since their goalkeeper went to Liverpool conceding seven goals in four games. The only point Bologna has so far came from a game with Frosinone. Roma has an advantage in their head to head matches, winning 18 out of 31 matches they have met in so far. While the home crowd will provide some support for Bologna, Roma just has much more quality and will prove too much for the hosts. The team from Rome have scored in every match they have played this season and they are likely to score a few in this one.

Both Lazio and Genoa have won their last respective games but Genoa has played one less game as one of the games from August was postponed. Lazio have began the 2018/19 campaign with two defeats against Juventus and Napoli but have since recovered and managed to score two wins against the bottom three side Frosinone and the newly promoted Serie B champions, Empoli. Both were close wins. Genoa are in 7th place in the table with two wins out of three games, while Lazio are 8th with the same number of points from four games played. These two sides have met 23 times before; genoa won 10 times and Lazio nine. Last year Lazio finished fifth in the Scudetto and will also be playing in the Europa League this season. Genoa might look for a chance there, if the Romans have to mix their starting eleven players to account for the extra games. A draw is likely.

Fans at Marc'Antonio Bentegodi Stadium should expect a fight from the home side Chievo trying to get their first triumph of this season. Even though their last two games earned them two points, they are dead last in the table with -1 points because they were deducted three points due to false accounting. However, this should not deter Chievo players to keep on improving and get more points from this game. Their opponents are Udinese, who have only lost one match this season, recording one win and two draws to currently earn them shared 9th place with two other teams, all with a goal difference of zero. Chievo have also conceded the most goals out of all Serie A teams, eleven in total, and six of them against Fiorentina. Historically, in the 34 games they met in, Udinese have more wins, but the predominant result is a draw; they have drawn 14 games. We expect another one here.

Stadio Giuseppe Meazza will host Tuesday’s football match between Inter and Fiorentina. Inter were on the verge of sharing the spoils with Sampdoria at the weekend, but Marcelo Brozovic eventually scored the winner for the Nerazzurri in the dying minutes of the game. Luciano Spalletti’s troops were more than fortunate to win both, their last league game and the Champions League opener against Tottenham, but victories count and nothing else matters. The Viola, on the other hand, recorded a routine 3-0 win over SPAL in their last league match, but seeing that their away record is anything but good, we do not believe that there is a value in betting on the visitors. Inter regained a much-needed confidence and seeing that they are eager to stay in the race for the title, we predict that Luciano Spalletti’s charges are going to extend their winning run in the Italian top flight.

Stadio Giuseppe Meazza will host Tuesday’s football match between Inter and Fiorentina. Inter were on the verge of sharing the spoils with Sampdoria at the weekend, but Marcelo Brozovic eventually scored the winner for the Nerazzurri in the dying minutes of the game. Luciano Spalletti’s troops were more than fortunate to win both, their last league game and the Champions League opener against Tottenham, but victories count and nothing else matters. The Viola, on the other hand, recorded a routine 3-0 win over SPAL in their last league match, but seeing that their away record is anything but good, we do not believe that there is a value in betting on the visitors. Inter regained a much-needed confidence and seeing that they are eager to stay in the race for the title, we predict that Luciano Spalletti’s charges are going to extend their winning run in the Italian top flight.

Roma play host to Frosinone at Stadio Olimpico on day 6 of the new Serie A campaign. The Giallorossi did not kick off the new season in style, with the team collecting only 5 points from possible 15, but they are widely expected to beat Frosinone in the “Eternal City”. This has to go down as a must-win game for Roma, who were beaten by Bologna at the weekend, and we predict that the Romans are going to prove their worth on the field. The newcomers, on the other hand, are determined to secure the Serie A survival, but that is easier said than done. Frosinone do not seem to be capable of producing fine performances at this level and we predict that they are going to return home empty-handed from the trip to Rome. As always, Edin Dzeko will lead the line for the hosts.

Napoli will be aiming to build on a 3-1 win over Torino when they host Parma at their Stadio San Paolo on Matchday 6. The Neapolitans failed to beat Crvena zvezda in Belgrade in their Champions League opener, but they rolled over Torino in their last league fixture. Carlo Ancelotti’s troops did well to beat Milan and Fiorentina in previous two home games in the Champions League and they are considered hot favourites to emerge triumphant in Wednesday’s football game. Parma made a slow start to the season, but they have been showing signs of improvement of late. The Gialloblu head into the midweek fixture following back-to-back wins over Inter and Cagliari, but seeing that Napoli have turned their Stadio San Paolo into a real fortress, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts, who are eager to stay in the race for the title.

As expected, Juventus outplayed Frosinone on the road in their last league fixture, with the team keeping their 100% record intact. Cristiano Ronaldo has found his goal-scoring touch and the Portuguese superstar, who has already scored three goals in the Italian top flight, is likely to prove a handful for Bologna defenders. CR7 is eager to win everything with Juve and, no doubt, all eyes will be on him when the Rossoblu welcome Bologna at their Allianz Stadium. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, desperately needed a win against Roma at the weekend and they managed to get one. Filipo Inzaghi’s troops gave fans something to cheer about, but they will have a much bigger fish to fry in Wednesday’s football game against the reigning champions. Juventus made a flying start to the season and we do not believe that Bologna are capable of spoiling the Bianconeri’s party at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara.

Genoa will be aiming to bounce back from a heavy 4-1 loss to Lazio when they host Chievo at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris on Wednesday evening. The Rossoblu are eager to secure yet another Serie A survival, but they need to improve their away record if they are to meet the goal. On the other hand, Genoa have been impressive at home ground this term and they are eager to record their third consecutive victory at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. Chievo Verona head into Wednesday’s football game following a 2-0 loss to Udinese and seeing that they have yet to record a win in the 2018/2019 season, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. In their last meeting in the Italian top flight Genoa emerged triumphant and, taking everything into account, there is a big value in betting on the hosts.

Atalanta and Torino square off against each other at Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia in what is expected to be a real football festival. Atalanta are eyeing their only second win of the season and they will be looking to put an end to their four-game winless run in the Italian top flight when they take on Torino in the midweek fixture. The Orobici came from behind to share the spoils with Milan at Stadio San Siro at the weekend and they are definitely capable of beating Torino in front of home fans. Atalanta do not represent Italy in European competitions and seeing that they are fully focused on the national championship, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. Il Toro, on the other hand, experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 3-1 loss to Napoli and given their poor away record in the Serie A, home win should be considered.

Wednesday’s football game at Sardegna Arena pits together Cagliari and Sampdoria, the two teams who have entirely different ambitions for the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign. Cagliari aim to secure yet another Serie A survival, whilst Sampdoria are eager to book their place in European competitions. The Rososblu head into the midweek fixture following a 2-0 loss to Parma, whereas La Samp are eager to bounce back from a 1-0 defeat to Inter. Sampdoria were more than unfortunate not to grab something from the Inter game as the Nerazzurri scored the winner in the stoppage time, but Marco Giampaolo’s troops are definitely capable of holding Cagliari to a draw in Sardinia. In their last meeting at Sardegna Arena in the Italian top flight the two teams shared the spoils and we predict that the history is going to repeat itself.

After dropping two points in a 2-2 draw with Atalanta, Milan will be looking to return to winning ways in the Serie A when they take on Empoli at Stadio Carlo Castellani on Thursday evening. The Rossoneri do not seem to be on top of their game at the start of the season and that is the main reason why we believe away win should not be considered. Summer signing Gonzalo Higuain is likely to lead the line for the visitors against Empoli, but seeing that the Azzurri are tough to beat at home, we predict the two teams are going to share the spoils in Thursday’s football match. The two teams are almost level on points in the Serie A standings and, taking everything into account, a close encounter is on the cards. In their last meeting in the Italian top flight Empoli defeated Milan at Stadio San Siro.

Stadio Paolo Mazza will host Thursday’s football game between SPAL and Sassuolo. As expected, SPAL were beaten by Fiorentina at Stadio Artemio Franchi in their last league match, but it is well known that they produce much better showings at home than on the travels. SPAL aim to keep their 100% record at home intact and seeing that they outplayed the likes of Parma and Atalanta in previous two home fixtures, we believe that there is a big value in betting on Leonardo Semplici’s charges. The Neroverdi, on the other hand, outclassed Empoli on home soil in their last league fixture, but seeing that they struggle on the road as well, we predict that the hosts are going to pick up all three points from Thursday’s football match. You should bear in mind, though, that SPAL are after their first ever win over Sassuolo in all competitions.

Inter will be looking to build on back-to-back wins over the likes of Sampdoria and Fiorentina when they host Cagliari at their Stadio Giuseppe Meazza. Inter obviously have big ambitions for the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign and they need to win matches against Cagliari and fellow bottom-table sides if they are to stay in the race for Scudetto. The Nerazzurri are a real force to be reckoned with at home and seeing that the Rossoblu suffered a 2-0 loss to Parma in their last away game in the national championship, home win should be considered. The Sardinians failed to score in previous two league fixtures, which is yet another reason why we are tempted to put our money on Luciano Spalletti’s troops. You should bear in mind that Inter emerged triumphant in each of their previous three meetings in the Italian top flight.

Saturday’s football game at Allianz Stadium pits together Juventus and Napoli, the two main candidates for Scudetto. The Bianconeri recorded a 2-0 win over Bologna in midweek, with the team keeping their 100% record in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign intact. Cristiano Ronaldo has yet to find his best form, but it is more than obvious that the Portuguese helped the title holders improve their game. A win over Napoli will see Juve move one step closer to defending trophy, therefore, we predict Max Allegri’s troops will adopt an attack-minded approach in the Serie A derby. The Partenopei, on the other hand, recorded a routine 3-0 win over Parma on Wednesday evening and it has to be noted that coach Carlo Ancelotti rested several first-team regulars for the Juventus clash. Taking everything into account, a close encounter is on the horizon at Allianz Stadium and we believe that the two title contenders are going to share the spoils on Matchday 7.

There will be fireworks when Roma and Lazio face each other at Stadio Olimpico in the first Rome derby of the season. The Giallorossi desperately needed a win against Frosinone at the weekend and they managed to get one. Eusebio Di Francesco’s troops rolled over the newcomers 4-0 in the midweek fixture and, no doubt, they regained a much-needed confidence. Turkish winger Under found the net against Frosinone, meaning that the opposition defenders should have him at bay in the local derby. The Biancocelesti, on the other hand, extended their winning run to four games on Wednesday evening, with the team beating Udinese 2-1 on the road. Lazio have found their best form of late and they are definitely capable of grabbing something from Saturday’s football match. The two sides seem to be evenly matched in the 2018/2019 season, therefore, we predict that they are going to share the spoils in the Rome derby.

Following back-to-back wins over the likes of Inter and Cagliari, Parma suffered a 3-0 loss to Napoli at Stadio San Paolo in their last league match. The Gialloblu’s main goal is to secure the Serie A survival and they should be looking for points in games against bottom-table sides if they are to meet the goal. It is well known that Parma produce much better displays at home than on the travels and they should take advantage of the fact that Empoli made a slow start to the season. The Azzurri experienced all sorts of problems in a 3-1 loss to Sassuolo in their last away game in the Serie A, which is yet another reason why we are tempted to put our money on the hosts. In their last meeting in the Italian top flight Empoli crushed Parma 4-0, meaning that the Gialloblu are hungry for revenge.

Frosinone will be looking to put an end to their six-game winless run in the Serie A when they host Genoa at their Stadio Benito Stirpe on Sunday afternoon. Frosinone have yet to find the net in the 2018/2019 season and, no doubt, they are eager to give fans some cheer. Seeing that their next rivals Bologna often struggle on the travels, we predict that the hosts are going to grab something from Sunday’s football match. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, defeated Chievo 2-0 in front of home fans in midweek, with the team keep their 100% record at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris intact. Genoa, though, have yet to record a win on the road, therefore, we predict that they are going to play out a draw with Frosinone at Stadio Benito Stirpe. In their last meeting in Frosinone the two sides shared the spoils (2-2).

Chievo will be aiming to record their first win of the season when they host Torino at their Stadio Marc’Antonio Bentegodi on day 7 of the new Serie A campaign. The Mussi Volanti made a very slow start to the season and they must be low on confidence ahead of Sunday’s football match. Chievo failed to find the net in previous two league fixtures and despite the fact that Torino are not regarded as good travelers, we are tempted to put our money on the away team. Il Toro did well to hold Atalanta to a goalless draw on Wednesday evening and they are definitely capable of beating Chievo in the “City of Love”. Torino are undefeated in previous four meetings with Chievo in the Italian top flight, which is yet another reason why away win should be considered.

As expected, Bologna were beaten by Juventus at Allianz Stadium in their last league fixture. The Rossoblu remained in the relegation zone in the Serie A standings, meaning that Sunday’s football match against Udinese is of big importance for the hosts. It is well known that Bologna produce much better showings at home than on the travels and we predict that they are going to fight tooth and nail against the Zebrette. Udinese, on the other hand, aim to bounce back from a 2-1 loss to Lazio and the fact that they outplayed Chievo in their last away game in the Serie A is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the trip to Bologna. However, seeing that the hosts want this win more than the visitors, we predict that Filipo Inzaghi’s troops are going to emerge triumphant in Sunday’s clash.

Fiorentina and Atalanta square off against each other at Stadio Artemio Franchi in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Sunday’s program in the Serie A. Fiorentina continue with their habit of producing fine displays at home, but their away record is anything but good. The Viola rolled over SPAL 3-0 in their last home match in the Italian top flight, but Inter proved to be a big catch for them on Tuesday evening. Atalanta, on the other hand, have been playing below expectations in the 2018/2019 season, with the team recording only one win to date. The Orobici obviously struggle to find their best form and seeing that over the years Fiorentina have turned their Stadio Artemio Franchi into a real fortress, we predict that the hosts are going to pick up all three points from Sunday’s football match.

Sassuolo take on Milan at their MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore on day 7 of the new Serie A campaign. The Neroverdi have been impressive at home ground this season, with the team recording a win in each of their three home fixtures. Following a hard-fought 1-0 win over Inter, Sassuolo defeated the likes of Genoa and Empoli in front of home fans, meaning that Milan face a difficult task in Sunday’s football game. The Rossoneri are no longer considered favourites to win Scudetto. The club chiefs did well to sign Gonzalo Higuain in the summer transfer window, but the Stadio San Siro outfit made a very slow start to the season. Milan have been struggling to find their best form at the start of the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign and seeing that the Neroverdi are a real force to be reckoned with at home, we predict the two teams will share the spoils on Matchday 7.

Having played out a goalless draw with Cagliari in Sardinia on Wednesday evening, Sampdoria will be aiming to return to winning ways in Serie A when they host SPAL at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. La Samp failed to find the net in previous two league fixtures, but they will not have a better chance than this to get back on course. Sampdoria outclassed star-studded Napoli in front of home fans earlier this season, therefore, it is no surprise they are seen as favourites to win Monday’s football match. SPAL, on the other hand, have been struggling on the travels of late, with the team losing to Torino and Fiorentina and, taking everything into account, we do not believe that they are capable of spoiling La Samp’s party at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. A man to watch in the home team will be French attacker Defrel, who has netted four goals in the Serie A so far this term.

Torino finished the 2017/2018 Serie A campaign in ninth position in the standings, but they have been struggling in the new season in the Italian top flight. Il Toro sit in the 16th position in the Serie A standings ahead of Sunday’s football match against Chievo and they are on a three-game winless run in the Italian top flight. Torino, though, will not have a better chance than this to return to winning ways in the Italian top flight as they host struggling Frosinoner at their Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino on Friday evening. The Canarini, on the other hand, suffered a loss in each of their previous five league fixtures, therefore, we do not believe that they are capable of shocking Torino on Matchday 8. You should bear in mind that Torino recorded a 3-1 victory over Frosinone in their last meeting in the Italian elite division.

Cagliari will be looking to put an end to their four-game winless run in the Serie A when they host Bologna at their Sardegna Arena on day 8 of the new Serie A campaign. Cagliari failed to score in previous three league fixtures and, no doubt, they are eager to give fans something to cheer about. The Sardinians sit in the danger zone in the Serie A standings ahead of the visit of Bologna and we predict that they are going to fight tooth and nail in Saturday’s football match. The Bolognesi continue with their habit of producing fine showings at home, but they still struggle on the travels. The Rossoblu have yet to find the net on the road in the 2018/2019 season, which is probably the main reason why we do not believe that they are going to spoil Cagliari’s party at Sardegna Arena.

Juventus will be aiming to build on a 3-1 win over Napoli in the Serie A derby when they take on Udinese at Dacia Arena on day 8 of the new Serie A campaign. Cristiano Ronaldo failed to find the net in the victory over Carlo Ancelotti’s troops, but Juve recorded a win in each of their seven league fixtures in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign, meaning that the Portuguese undisputedly helped the Italian giants improve their game. Juventus aim to clinch top position in the Serie A standings and we predict that they are going to stick to their attacking style of play in Saturday’s football match against Udinese. The Zebrette suffered back-to-back losses to the likes of Lazio and Bologna in previous two league fixtures and seeing that the Bianconeri are brimming with confidence following the triumph over Napoli, away win should be considered.

Roma will be looking to build on a 3-1 win over Lazio in the Rome derby when they square off against Empoli at Stadio Carlo Castellani on Matchday 8. The Romans have found their form of late, but they need to keep on improving their game if they are to rejoin the race for Scudetto. Serbian international Aleksandar Kolarov has found his goal-scoring touch of late, meaning that the opposition defenders should have him at bay. Empoli, on the other hand, are on a six-game winless run in the Italian top flight and they head into Saturday’s football match following a 1-0 loss to Parma. The Azzurri are eager to escape the relegation zone, but seeing that the Giallorossi got back on course, we do not believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. Lorenzo Pellegrini, who scored against Lazio at the weekend, is likely to return to the starting line-up for the visitors.

Lazio and Fiorentina face each other at Stadio Olimpico in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Sunday’s program. Lazio aim to bounce back from a heartbreaking loss to Roma in the Rome derby, but seeing that the Biancocelesti could be low on confidence when they face Fiorentina on Matchday 8, home win should not be considered. Ciro Immobile, who found the net in the local derby, will be the man to watch in the home side. The Viola, on the other hand, have been impressive at home ground of late, with the team beating SPAL and Atalanta at their Stadio Artemio Franchi, but beating Lazio in the “Eternal City” is easier said than done. A close encounter is on the cards and we predict that Lazio and Fiorentina are going to share the spoils at Stadio Olimpico.

After suffering a 3-1 loss to Juventus in the Serie A derby at the weekend, Napoli will be aiming to start a new winning run in the national championship when they host Sassuolo at their Stadio San Paolo. The Neapolitans are determined to stay in the race for Scudetto and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at Sassuolo on Matchday 8. The Partenopei are a real force to be reckoned with at home and seeing that they recorded a routine 3-0 win over Parma in their last home fixture in the Italian top flight, we are tempted to put our money on Carlo Ancelotti’s charges. Sassuolo have been in a fine form at the start of the season, but Napoli are likely to pose a much bigger threat for the Neroverdi than their previous rivals. When the two teams met at Stadio San Paolo last term Napoli outplayed Sassuolo 3-1.

Buoyed by a thrilling 4-1 victory at Sassuolo, Milan face Chievo at their Stadio San Siro on Matchday 8. The Rossoneri did well to put an end to their three-game winless run in the Serie A at the weekend and they must be high on confidence ahead of Sunday’s football match. Suso scored a brace in a 4-1 victory over the Neroverdi, meaning that the opposition defenders should have him at bay. Milan are eager to climb to the top half of the Serie A standings and we predict that they are going to fight tooth and nail against Chievo. The Mussi Volanti, on the other hand, are stuck at the bottom of the standings and seeing that they failed to score in previous two league fixtures, we do not believe that they are capable of spoiling Milan’s party at Stadio San Siro.

Inter will be aiming to extend their winning run in the Serie A to four games when they take on SPAL at Stadio Paolo Mazza on Matchday 8. The Nerazzurri quickly bounced back from a shocking 1-0 loss to Parma, but they need to keep on raising their form if they are to stay in the race for Scudetto. Luciano Spalletti’s charges play on three fronts in the Italian top flight, but that does not seem to be a problem for the Serie A team. SPAL, on the other hand, suffered back-to-back losses to the likes of Fiorentina and Sassuolo in previous two league fixtures and we do not believe that they are capable of matching the in-form Nerazzurri at their Stadio Paolo Mazza. A man to watch in the away team will be Mauro Icardi, who is eager to add more goals to his account.

Following a 2-0 win over Chievo, Genoa defeated Frosinone on the road in their last league fixture. The Rossoblu have been impressive at home ground in the 2018/2019 season and, to make things even better for the fans, they defeated their first away win of the season at the weekend. Genoa aim to retain their spot in top ten and they are seen as favourites to win Sunday’s football match against Parma. The newcomers, on the other hand, have been playing above expectations on their return to the Italian top flight, but seeing that Genoa have turned their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris into a real fortress, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. In their last meeting in Genoa the Rossoblu recorded a 2-0 victory over Parma and we predict that the history is going to repeat itself.

Atalanta and Sampdoria face each other at Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia in what is expected to be a very entertaining game. Atalanta aim to bounce back from a 2-0 loss to Fiorentina, whilst Sampdoria are eager to put an end to their three-game winless run in the Serie A. The Orobici have been struggling to find their best form at the start of the season, but seeing that they failed to make it to the Europa League group stages, we predict that Gian Piero Gasperini’s troops are going to return to get back on course soon. Sampdoria, on the other hand, have been having their ups and downs of late, but they are definitely capable of sharing the spoils with the out-of-form Orobici in Bergamo. The two teams seem to be evenly matched at the moment and we believe that they are going to play out a draw at Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia.

Udinese, struggling near the bottom of the Serie A table, are welcoming the 2nd placed team in the Scudetto, Napoli. The venue for the match will be the Dacia Arena in Udine. Apart from the two matches they lost, first against Sampdoria and then recently to Juventus, Napoli have been in great form, winning seven out of their last ten matches. The only other hick up this year was the game in Belgrade when they were held to a goalless draw against Red Star. Out of their seven wins, they kept a clean sheet four times, including the somewhat surprising win against Liverpool in the Champions League. Udinese are 15th in the standings and have lost the last three games in row in Serie A. Overall, they are not in great form, having only three wins, four defeats and three draws in their last ten matches. They are up for another setback in this home game, with Napoli the favourites to win and keep on chasing Juventus.

In this Saturday kick-off game, Roma are hosting SPAL at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. This will be the first match of Round 9 of this years Serie A. Roma are sitting in 6th place now, level on points with the 5th placed Sampdoria. SPAL are languishing in the 14th place. They have lost the last four games in the Scudetto and in fact, five of the last six. And after it all started so well for them, winning the two opening games of the season. Roma have started the season OK but then lost it for a little bit recording two defeats and two draws in Serie A and one defeat in Champions League against Real Madrid. The loss to Bologna seemed to be a turning point for them as they have won four games in a row since and are not looking to stop that run against SPAL. We predict a high scoring home win.

The 2017/18 Scudetto Champions are once again running the show in Italy. They are top of the table, undefeated and with the maximum 24 points. They have scored 18 goals and only Sampdoria has conceded less goals than them. The “Old Lady” is hosting the team from Genoa in this match, at the Juventus Stadium. Juventus are currently unbeaten in all competitions in their last ten matches with six clean sheets. During that period, they won a couple of Champions League matches too. After the acquisition of Cristiano Ronaldo from Real Madrid, one wonders who could beat them this year in Italy. Genoa are currently in 11th place with 12 points, four wins and three defeats from seven games, as their first match of the season was postponed and will be played later. In their last six matches they won three and lost three, including the last match, against Parma. This match should be an easy one for Juventus.

The most anticipated game of this round is the Milan derby between Inter Milan and AC Milan. This time, Inter Milan will play hosts at the Giuseppe Meazza stadium. Even though Inter are up in third place, neither team will be happy how the season has started for them. And of course, AC Milan have played one game less than Inter, because their opening game against Genoa was moved to another date. Inter Milan were beaten by Sassuolo in their opening match of the season, which was surely the most shocking result of the first round. Since then, they only lost once and that was another surprise as they were beaten by the newly promoted Parma. AC Milan have opened their account with a defeat to Napoli and that was their only loss so far. Both teams are unbeaten in their last six matches, but, while Inter have recorded six wins in that period, AC Milan have four wins and two draws. A draw in this game night be a good bet.

After finishing 15th last year, Bologna will want to do better this season and they are currently not managing it, as they are in 16th place. Torino finished 9th last year and are 12th right now. The game will be played at the Renato Dall’Ara stadium in Bologna. Torino are having a bit of a run in the last seven games as they only lost one match during that time, against the 2nd placed Napoli, and are unbeaten in their last three matches in Serie A, even though those wins were against the two of the worst team in the league right now. Bologna, on the other hand, have two wins in the last eight matches, one against Roma and the other one in round 7 of the Scudetto, against Udinese. Torino are in better form and should be expected to pick up all three points from this away game.

This bottom of the table encounter will be played at the Stadio Benito Stirpe in Frosinone between the home team and Empoli. Both teams were promoted to Serie A this year, Empoli as Serie B Champions and Frosinone through the playoffs. Frosinone are sitting in the second to last place in the standings and are not last only because Chievo were deducted three points due to financial irregularities and are on -1 in points. Otherwise, Frosinone have only one point and the worst goal difference by a far, having conceded 21 goals and scoring only three. Empoli are above Frosinone in the table with five points and a chance to move out of the relegation zone if they defeat Frosinone. Empoli has one victory this season, recorded on the first day of the season against Cagliari, and their opponents are yet to win. It really is anyone’s game, and Frosinone fans will be cheering their team on to try and get that all important first win.

The Viola are hosting Cagliari in this game at the Artemio Franchi Stadium. Fiorentina are currently sitting 7th in the table while Cagliari are 13th. Neither of the two teams are consistent in their last six matches. Fiorentina has started the season in good form, recording two wins, against Chievo and Udinese before losing to Napoli. After that, it was a mixed bag of results; two victories, two defeats and a draw. In their last encounter, they went down to Lazio 1:0. Cagliari suffered a little shock in the opening match of the season, losing to newcomers Empoli, but have recovered and only lost twice since that game. The rest were three wins, including the 2:0 win against Bologna in their last game, and three draws. One of these wins was a friendly game. If we look at the positions in the table, Fiorentina are favourites, but we think it will be a draw.

In another bottom of the table matchup, Atalanta are travelling to Verona to play the home side Chievo at the Marc’Antonio Bentegodi stadium. Chievo who are trying to get into the plus side of the points after they had three points deducted because of the club’s accounting infringements. A point against Atalanta will see them back to zero points and a win will lift them past the fellow strugglers and the only other team still to win a game this year, Frosinone. Officially, Chievo have recorded two draws and six defeats in the first eight rounds. Atalanta have one win under their belt, in the opening match of the season, when they beat Frosinone 4:0. Since then, they failed to qualify for the Europa League and are on a run of five defeats and four draws. Both teams lost the last two matches they were involved in and it’s anyone’s guess what will happen in this match. We predict a home win.

While Parma was second in Serie B last year and promoted, Lazio finished fifth last season and managed to qualify for the Europa League group stage. Now they meet in round 9 of this season of Serie A, at the Ennio Tardini ground. Lazio are flying high again, in 4th place and Parma is in a solid 9th spot with only two points less than their opponents in this game. Lazio have won five out the last six matches to propel them to the top four in the table after they opened the season with two defeats against Napoli and Juventus. Even though they lost to Roma in round 7, they rebounded and beat Fiorentina in their last match. Parma have four wins in their last five games and five in their last seven matches, with only the one loss against Napoli in a round 6 encounter. This will be close, but Lazio are favourites to bring home three points.

The fans at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium will be watching the final game of round 9 between Sampdoria and Sassuolo. The two teams are separated by a point in the standings. Sampdoria are in 5th and Sassuolo in 8th place. The main difference between the teams might be their defensive performances. While Sampdoria have conceded only four goals so far (the best in the league), only two teams have conceded more goals than Sassuolo and they are tied for third with Genoa. The home side is in better form right now, with only one defeat in their last six games in the Scudetto, while Sassuolo have suffered three defeats in the same period. These two teams finished next to each other in the table last year and are very close now. One goal might decide the winner in this match, but we are tipping the Samp for a home win.

Last season, Fiorentina won both games against Torino. In the end, they finished next to each other in the table, 8th and 9th. The first game of this season is in Torino, at the Olimpico. After nine rounds, Fiorentina are sixth in the table level with Sampdoria in fifth, while Torino are a point behind in 10th, level on points with three other teams. Their form, coming into this game is not consistent, although Torino haven’t lost in the last four matches. In fact, they have only lost once in six matches. At home, they won two and lost two games. The Viola have just one win in the last four games, and two in six, together with two defeats and two draws, including the one against Cagliari in the last round. What’s important, they are still to win away from home this year. This might be the game when they will. They have been scoring more and have defended better making them favourites to win this one.

On Saturday afternoon, Serie B champions Empoli are hosting Serie A champions Juventus at the Carlo Castellani stadium. Juventus have dropped points for the first time this season in a draw with Genoa in the last round. This will encourage other teams, even Empoli, to attack Juve. In their return stint in Serie A, Empoli are not playing well. They have only managed one victory so far and are third from the bottom in the table. They are without a win in their last six matches, where they have four defeats and two draws, including the 3:3 draw with Frosinone in the last round. Before that, Empoli have only scored five goals in eight matches, which has been a problem. And the last time they managed to beat Juventus was in 2007! Juventus are clear favourites to win this game and they will be taking all three points back home to Torino.

Parma, who earned promotion from Serie B this year, have been in good form lately. In the first game of round 10, they are travelling to the Atleti Azzurri d'Italia Stadium to play Atalanta. Parma are currently in 11th place in the table, but level on points with Sassuolo in eighth place. They have won four times in their last six matches to take them up the table. Before beating Chievo 5:1 in the last round, Atalanta didn’t win for five straight games, recording three defeats and two draws. Atalanta haven’t won at home since they beat Frosinone in August. Parma have managed two wins away from home in their last three matches, against Genoa and Inter. They are definitely turning out to be a surprise package this year in the Scudetto. Parma are playing better football but Atalanta are at home, so this match might just finish without a winner.

While Cagliari played out a draw with Fiorentina in the last round of the Scudetto, Chievo are rooted to the bottom of the table without much chance of moving up any time soon. In fact they are struggling to come back into the plus points. They have now lost five straight games and are still the only team apart from Frosinone not to have won a game yet this season. They have also conceded 24 goals already, which is double the number of goals third from bottom side Empoli had allowed in. Cagliari are 14th in the standings with ten points. Their form is not good; in the last six matches they had three draws, two defeats and only one victory, against struggling Bologna in round 8. Saying that, even if Chievo did pose a threat, Cagliari are unbeaten at home in Serie A this year, recording three wins and three draws. This will be another win for them.

Napoli have been chasing Juventus for two seasons now and will try to continue the chase on Sunday, at the San Paolo stadium, against Roma. They are second in the table, four points behind Juventus. Recent form is good apart from that one defeat to Juventus. And at home, they are unbeaten in the last ten matches. Roma will still be a little shell-shocked after a 2:0 defeat to SPAL in the last round. Before that, they had four wins one after another in all competitions. Both Napoli and Roma are playing in the Champions League as well. Roma beat Empoli in their last match away from home, but lost the four before scoring only two goals. Napoli haven’t been too secure in the back, and Roma will try to exploit that weakness. After Juventus and Napoli, they are the third best scoring team so far. For all neutral fans, this game will be a delight to watch. We predict a home win.
