Just one place above the relegation zone, Bologna are travelling to Sassuolo to play in this early kick-off encounter at the Citta Del Tricolore. Sassuolo had three tough matches prior to this one, losing to AC Milan at home and to Napoli away and playing Sampdoria as well. However, before losing to Milan in Round 7, they were unbeaten at home in seven matches. Bologna, on the other hand, haven’t won once in their last ten away matches. Recent form is inconsistent for both teams. Sassuolo have won three and lost three in the last six, before going to Sampdoria on Monday. Bologna have won two, lost three and drew one in the last six matches, the one draw coming in the last round against Torino. Sassuolo have been scoring a lot but also conceding a few goals while Bologna has struggled to finish in front of goal, netting only six goals so far. All in all, Sassuolo are clear favourites to win in front of their home fans.

After, some would say, heroically forcing Juventus to drop two points in the last round of the Scudetto, Genoa are welcoming Udinese at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium. Genoa have been in inconsistent form generally, winning three games, losing two and drawing the one against Juventus in the last six matches. This includes their surprising loss at home to newcomers Parma, where otherwise they have been unbeaten this season. Udinese have been in a slump having lost four matches in a row in the last four rounds. As for their away record – it isn’t great, out of four games played away; they only won once, lost twice and drew once. They are keeping Bologna company just above the relegation zone, having trouble scoring goals, same as Bologna. Genoa are up in 9th place but only a point off Sampdoria in fifth. Udinese will have a chance as Genoa have been weak defensively. A draw is quite possible.

Even though they have Higuain on loan from Juventus, who had scored a few goals for Juve last year, AC Milan have struggled, and are right now in 12th place in Serie A with 12 points. They are hosting Sampdoria at the San Siro on Sunday afternoon hoping to get their season into full swing. Before their defeat in the Milan derby last week they were in solid form with three straight wins, one of them being against Olympiacos in the Europa league. In their last six matches, they only lost the one to Inter. At home, they are unbeaten in the three matches so far this season. Sampdoria are in fifth place and only two points above AC Milan. They are in good form and have also only lost once in the last six matches, also to Inter Milan. Both teams have played a game less than most of the teams, because of previously postponed games. This should be an entertaining game with a few goals and a draw in the end.

When Frosinone earned promotion to Serie A through the promotion playoffs, they must have thought their time in the Scudetto would go differently. Instead they are one of the two teams in the league yet to win a game. This time, they are going away to play SPAL at the Paolo Mazza Stadium in Ferrara. Frosinone are second from bottom, with just two points from two draws. After a number of losses in a row, they managed to get a point from their trip to Empoli in the last round. This might be enough of an encouragement to try and get something against SPAL, especially since they managed to score three goals in one game, having previously scored just three in eight matches. SPAL are up in 13th place, level on points with AC Milan. SPAL pulled of a great, although surprising, victory over Roma in the last round, after four straight losses. If Frosinone can prevent SPAL from scoring, they might earn a point in this game.

On Monday, in the last game of round 10 in Serie A, we have a top of the table clash between the third placed Inter Milan and fourth in the table, Lazio. The Romans will host the match at the Olimpico. Inter players and fans will be on a high after a win in the Milan derby. After a couple of shocking losses in the first three games of the season, Inter have recovered and went on a run of seven straight wins in the last seven matches in all competitions including the two wins in the Champions League. Lazio have had mixed success in the Europa League, winning one and losing one game. Since the loss to Napoli on the opening day of the season, Lazio have been unbeaten at home. Inter, on the other hand, have been unbeaten away from home since the loss to Sassuolo in their opening match. This should be a great match where one flash of brilliance could decide the game for each team, however Inter Milan should just edge it.

Milan and Genoa face each other at Stadio Giuseppe Meazza in a postponed fixture. The Rossoneri aim to build on a 3-2 win over Sampdoria and a victory over Genoa will see them overtake Lazio in fourth place in the standings. Gonzalo Higuain scored his fifth goal of the season in the triumph over La Samp and all eyes will be on him when the Rossoneri face the Rossoblu in Wednesday’s football match. Genoa continue with their habit of producing much better showings at home than on the travels and seeing that they have already conceded 11 goals on the travels, we predict that the visitors are going to return home empty-handed. In their last meeting in the Italian top flight Milan recorded a hard-fought 1-0 win over Genoa, with Andre Silva scoring a late winner and that is yet another reason why home win should be considered.

The second placed Napoli team are welcoming Empoli at the San Paolo stadium. Napoli are coming away from two hard games. They managed to grab a point in Paris in the Champions League against the favoured PSG team and have been held by Roma in the last round of the Scudetto. Napoli have managed to lose two games so far in Serie A, against Juventus and Sampdoria, both of which were away games. Empoli, third from bottom, are without a win in the last ten matches. During that time, they were beaten six times but have managed to earn a point in four matches. Napoli are unbeaten at home this season, while Empoli haven’t won away from home. It’s hard to imagine anything but a convincing win for Napoli which would get them back to winning ways after those two draws. The last time Empoli defeated Napoli was back in 2015. That will stay unchanged after this game.

The second placed Napoli team are welcoming Empoli at the San Paolo stadium. Napoli are coming away from two hard games. They managed to grab a point in Paris in the Champions League against the favoured PSG team and have been held by Roma in the last round of the Scudetto. Napoli have managed to lose two games so far in Serie A, against Juventus and Sampdoria, both of which were away games. Empoli, third from bottom, are without a win in the last ten matches. During that time, they were beaten six times but have managed to earn a point in four matches. Napoli are unbeaten at home this season, while Empoli haven’t won away from home. It’s hard to imagine anything but a convincing win for Napoli which would get them back to winning ways after those two draws. The last time Empoli defeated Napoli was back in 2015. That will stay unchanged after this game.

In the last game of the Saturday kick-offs, Juventus are hosting Cagliari at the Juventus Stadium. Juventus are unbeaten in Serie A and Champions League this season. Apart from scoring the most goals in the Scudetto so far, they are also the 2nd best defence. The only points they dropped so far this season were the ones against Genoa in the last round. Somewhat like Paris Saint Germain in France, you wonder who is going to be able to beat them in the league this season. Cagliari, after four winless games, have managed to record two wins and a draw in the last three games. The last time Cagliari won away from home was against against Atalanta, early in September. They are unbeaten themselves in the last three games, but Juventus look like their form is still building up. And in their last ten head to head encounters, Juventus have won eight and they drew two.

Roma held Napoli to a somewhat surprising draw in the last round of Serie A. In this round, they are travelling to Fiorentina to play another team who are above them in the standings. The venue for this match is the Artemio Franchi Stadium. The team from Rome is definitely raising their form, losing only one game out of the last six matches. In the last ten matches, Roma have won five times, lost three and drawn two games. One of the more surprising loses was the one against SPAL. Fiorentina haven’t won in the last three matches, and managed one win in the last five. But they have been a fortress at home – they are unbeaten so far this season. The only two points they lost at home was to Cagliari, a week ago in round 9. Roma did get four points away from home in the last two matches. The Romans look like they are on a mission, so they might even take home all three points.

Chievo, after they were docked three points by the Italian football federation, have looked unable to get some points and move back into the positive; they are still at -1. Sassuolo haven’t been able to win in the last four matches. These two teams are meeting on Sunday at the Marc'Antonio Bentegodi in Verona. Chievo have now lost six straight games and are dead last in the table. Not only that, but they have also conceded the most goals out of all the teams in the Scudetto. Sassuolo are in 9th place and are one of the five teams with 15 points from 5th to 10th. In their last six matches they have two wins, two defeats and two draws including the two in their last two matches, a goalless draw against Sampdoria away and a 2:2 draw with Bologna at home. Also, Sassuolo have only won one game away from home this year, so again, Chievo has a chance, but the question is whether they can lift themselves up to get at least a point.

In the evening Sunday kick-off, AC Milan are visiting Udinese at the Dacia Arena. The team from Milan are fifth in the table and will have a chance to go level with Lazio in fourth when they play a re-scheduled match against Genoa in midweek, before travelling to Udine. Udinese are down in 16th place, without a win in five games. They did however manage to draw with Genoa in the last round, after four straight defeats. Last time they won was a little more than a month ago, against Chievo. Milan have also been playing in the Europa League where they have a win and a defeat so far. As for Serie A, they only have one defeat in the last eight matches, with four wins and three draws. Udinese have lost three games in a row at home, while AC Milan have gone four games without a defeat away from home before the loss in the Milan derby a week ago. Udinese are unlikely to get anything out of this game, with AC Milan the favourites.

The late Sunday afternoon kick-off time is reserved for the match between Bologna and Atlanta. They will be locking horns at the Renato Dall'Ara Stadium. Bologna are fourth from bottom with 9 points, level on points with Udinese above them. Atalanta are in 14th, level on points with SPAL in 15th. Interestingly, they have the fourth best goal difference in Serie but still they are low in the table. Atalanta were without a win for a while before they beat Chievo 5:1 away in round 9. In the last round they were triumphant once again, beating Parma 3:0 at home. Overall, in the last ten matches, apart from these two wins, they have five defeats and three draws. Bologna have played a couple of 2:2 draws in their last two matches, against Torino at home and Sassuolo away. They are unbeaten at home in the last three games but also, they only have two defeats in the last six games. Still, Atalanta are the fourth best scoring team this year which might be enough to break Bologna at home.

In round 10, Frosinone, promoted from Serie B this year and in only their second ever Serie A season, finally won their first game in the Scudetto this year and did so emphatically, by beating SPAL 3:0. After drawing 3:3 with Empoli in the previous round, you might say that they are on a run of two games unbeaten, four points and six goals scored. Now they are travelling to Parma, to take on the home side who were also promoted from Serie B this year. They are playing the match at the Ennio Tardini Stadium. Parma haven’t been consistent this year but they are in 13th place only two points from fifth place AC Milan. In their last ten matches, Parma have recorded five victories, four defeats and one draw. At home, they’ve won twice, drawn once and lost twice, including the last home match against Lazio. Frosinone will be playing the second straight game away from home and if they carry on the momentum, anything can happen, but a draw is probably the most likely result.

Sampdoria is another one of those five teams with 15 points, in seventh place, while Torino are in 11th place with one less point. They will play each other at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium on Sunday afternoon. The two sides are playing in similar forms lately. In the last six matches, both have two wins. Sampdoria has two defeats and two draws while Torino has one defeat and three draws. Sampdoria lost 3:2 to AC Milan in the last round. Torino drew 1:1 with Fiorentina at home. Samp have been strong at home this season, with two wins, two draws and one defeat against Inter. Torino haven’t played that bad away from home; they managed a win and four draws so indeed, they are unbeaten as visitors. This might give them a chance against Sampdoria. Four out of their last six head to head encounters were draws. It looks like a draw in this game as well.

With six wins and three defeats this season, Lazio are yet to draw a match, but they will have a chance for that against Inter Milan before the play SPAL in round 11. The Romans are fourth in the table, just behind Inter. The game against SPAL will take place at the Stadio Olimpico in a noon kick-off. Funnily enough, SPAL also haven’t drawn a match this season, and they are the only two teams in Serie A without a tied game this year. SPAL are 15th in the table with 12 points but only a win away from AC Milan in 5th place. That’s how close it is in the middle of the table. Lazio have eight wins and two defeats in the last ten matches. SPAL have four wins and six defeats. Lazio have won the last four games at home in Serie A and the Europa league, while SPAL has two wins away from home, but one in the last four games. The others were defeats. Lazio are favourites to take all three points here.

Stadio Benito Stirpe will host Friday’s football game between Frosinone and Fiorentina, the two teams with completely different ambitions in the 2018/2019 Serie A season. Frosinone aim to secure the top flight survival, whilst the Viola are eyeing a place in European competitions. The Lions have been showing signs of improvement of late, with the team sharing the spoils with Empoli and Parma, while beating SPAL on the road in previous three league fixtures. Frosinone, though, need to keep on raising their form if they are to move away from the relegation zone. The Viola, on the other hand, suffered a dip in form, with the team failing to win previous four league games. However, it has to be noted that they faced a tough fixture list and seeing that they will not have a better chance than this to get back on course, we are tempted to put our money on the visitors.

Following a 2-0 win over Roma, SPAL suffered back-to-back defeats to the likes of Frosinone and Lazio in previous two league fixtures and it has to be noted that they conceded seven goals in total in those games. Leonardo Semplici’s men have been struggling at the back of late, but Saturday’s football match against Cagliari could be the turning point for them. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, suffered a 3-1 loss to Juventus in Turin, with the Bianconeri putting an end to their three-game unbeaten run in the Italian top flight. Cagliari undisputedly produce much better displays at home than on the travels, which is the main reason why we believe that there is a value in betting on the hosts, who are desperate to return to winning ways. You should bear in mind that SPAL are eyeing their third consecutive home win of the season.

Buoyed by a 4-1 win over Sampdoria in Genoa, Torino play host to Parma at their Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino on Matchday 12. Il Toro have been in a fine form of late and seeing that a win over Parma should see them climb to the Europa League berth, we predict that the hosts will fight tooth and nail against the newcomers. It is well known that Torino are a real force to be reckoned with at home and we predict that they are going to prove their worth on the field. The Giallorossi, on the other hand, failed to find the net in previous three league fixtures, which is yet another reason why we are tempted to put our money on the hosts. A man to watch in the home side will be Andrea Belotti, who scored a brace in the 4-1 win over La Samp.

Napoli will be looking to build on a 5-1 win over Empoli when they face Genoa at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris on Matchday 12. The Neapolitans aim to stay in the race for Scudetto and we predict that they are going to adopt an attack-minded approach in Saturday’s football match against the Rossoblu. Carlo Ancelotti’s men have been scoring goals for fun of late, but the game against Genoa will be anything but a walk in the park for the last season’s runners-up. The Rossoblu have suffered only one loss at home this season, with the team losing to Parma at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris and seeing that Napoli outclassed Udinese 3-0 in their last away game in the national championship, we predict that the visitors, who are desperate to melt Juve’s advantage in the standings, are going to pick up all three points from Saturday’s match.

As expected, Empoli suffered a heavy 5-1 loss to Napoli at Stadio San Paolo in their last league match and it has to be noted that they conceded 10 goals in total in previous three league fixtures. The Azzurri obviously suffered a dip in form and seeing that they sit in the relegation zone ahead of Matchday 12, home win should not be considered. Udinese were more than unfortunate not to hold Milan to a goalless draw at the weekend as the Rossoneri scored the winner in the seventh minute of the stoppage time. The Zebrette are eager to bounce back from the unlucky defeat and seeing that Empoli have been struggling at the back of late, we predict that the visitors are going to emerge triumphant in Sunday’s football game. You should know that Udinese are after their first win over Empoli at Stadio Carlo Castellani since January 2015.

Lazio will be looking to build on a 4-1 victory over SPAL when they take on Sassuolo MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore. The Biancocelesti recorded three wins in previous four league fixtures and it is more than obvious that they are determined to book their place in the Champions League. Ciro Immobile scored a brace in the 4-1 win over SPAL and all eyes will be on the Italian attacker when Lazio face Sassuolo on Matchday 12. Yet another man to watch in the away team will be Serbian rising star Sergej-Milinkovic Savic, who has yet to find his best form. The Neroverdi, on the other hand, aim to put an end to their four-game winless run in the Italian top flight, but seeing that they have been struggling at the back of late, we predict that the capital club are going to emerge triumphant in Sunday’s football match.

All eyes will be on Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia when Atalanta and Inter face each other in the Serie A derby. The Orobici made a very slow start to the season, but they have been in a splendid form of late. Following back-to-back wins over Chievo and Parma, Atalanta defeated Bologna on the road in their last league match and, no doubt, they are brimming with confidence ahead of Sunday’s football match against Inter. The Nerazzurri hammered Genoa 5-0 at the weekend, with the team retaining second position in the Serie A standings. Inter are likely to stick to their attacking style of play against Atalanta and seeing that the Orobici have been scoring goals for fun of late as well, we are tempted to put our money on both teams to score. In their last meeting in Bergamo the two teams played out a draw.

Chievo and Bologna face each other at Stadio Marc’Antonio Bentegodi on day 12 of the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign. Chievo are on a seven-game losing run in the Italian top flight ahead of Sunday’s football match and you should bear in mind that they have minus one point in the Serie A standings. The situation is alarming in the “City of Love” ahead of the visit of Bologna and we do not believe that home win should be considered. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, are eager to make amends for a 2-1 loss to Atalanta and seeing that a win over the Mussi Volanti will see them move away from the danger zone, we are tempted to put our money on the visitors. A man to watch in the away side will be Paraguay attacker Federico Santander, who has netted three goals in the Italian elite division so far this term.

After sharing the spoils with the likes of Napoli and Fiorentina on the road, Roma will be looking to return to winning ways in the Serie A when they host Sampdoria at their Stadio Olimpico on Sunday afternoon. The Romans are only one point clear of La Samp in the Serie A standings, but seeing that they have turned their stadium into a real fortress, it is no surprise the Giallorossi are seen as hot favourites to win Sunday’s football match. Sampdoria experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 4-1 loss to Torino at the weekend, which is yet another reason why we are tempted to put our money on Eusebio Di Francesco’s troops. Edin Dzeko has netted only two goals in the Serie A so far this term, but the opposition defenders should have him at bay.

There will be fireworks when Milan and Juventus face each other at Stadio San Siro in the Serie A derby on Matchday 12. The Rossoneri head into the match following a hard-fought 1-0 win over Udinese, meaning that they are surely brimming with confidence. Genaro Gattuso’s men are a real force to be reckoned with at home and you should bear in mind that they are eyeing their fourth consecutive win in front of home fans. Juve, on the other hand, continue to impress in the 2018/2019 season, with the team dropping only two points in the Serie A so far this season. Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score in a 3-1 win over Cagliari at the weekend, but he provided an assist for Juan Cuadrado and, no doubt, all eyes will be on the former Real Madrid superstar when the Bianconeri face the Rossoneri at Stadio San Siro. Anyhow, seeing that Milan are tough to beat at home, we believe that there is a big value in betting on draw.

After suffering an embarrassing 4-1 loss to Atalanta in Bergamo on Matchday 13, Inter will be aiming to return to winning ways in the Serie A when they host Frosinone at their Stadio Giuseppe Meazza. The Nerazzurri are a real force to be reckoned with at home and you should bear in mind that they are eyeing their fifth consecutive victory in front of home fans. A man to watch in the home team will be Mauro Icardi, who is enjoying yet another season to remember. Frosinone, on the other hand, sit in the relegation zone in the Serie A standings and, no doubt, the team’s main goal is to secure the top flight survival. The Lions have been showing signs of improvement of late, they are on a four-game unbeaten run in the Italian top flight, but they will have a big fish to fry in Saturday’s football match.

Buoyed by a 4-1 win over Sampdoria, Roma take on Udinese at Dacia Arena in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Saturday’s program. The Giallorossi aim to stay in the race for a place in the Champions League and we predict that they are going to adopt an attack-minded approach in the football match against Udinese. A man to watch in the capital club will be El Shaarawy, who scored a brace against La Samp. The Zebrette do not seem to be on top of their game at the moment. The Dacia Arena outfit are on a seven-game winless run in the Italian top flight, with the team failing to win previous seven league fixtures. Roma have been in a much better form of late than Udinese and we predict that the visitors are going to pick up all three points from the match.

High-flying Juventus play host to SPAL at their Allianz Stadium on Matchday 13. The Bianconeri are leading the chase for Scudetto and they are six points clear of second-placed Napoli ahead of Saturday’s football game. Juventus did well to beat Milan at Stadio San Siro in their last league match, with Cristiano Ronaldo scoring his eighth goal of the season. CR7 has been raising his form week by week and we predict that he is going to pose a big threat for SPAL defenders. The Gli Spallini have been struggling at the back of late, with the team conceding nine goals in total in previous three league fixtures and it is no surprise they are considered big underdogs in Saturday’s clash against the title holders. David faces Goliath at Allianz Stadium on day 13, meaning that anything but a routine home win will be a major surprise.

Sunday’s football game at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara pits together Bologna and Fiorentina, the two sides who are desperate to return to winning ways in Serie A. Both sides failed to win their previous five league fixtures and, no doubt, there will be fireworks when they face each other on Matchday 13. The Rossoblu are only one point clear of the relegation zone ahead of the visit of Fiorentina, meaning that they are likely to leave their hearts on the field. The Viola, on the other hand, shared the spoils with each of their previous four rivals in the Italian top flight, but they are still sitting in the top half of the standings. Seeing that Bologna are tough to beat at home, a close encounter is on the cards and we predict that the two teams are going to share the spoils at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara.

Genoa and Sampdoria, the two bitter local rivals, face each other at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris in the Derby della Lanterna. Genoa are on a three-game losing run in the Serie A ahead of the local derby and they are surely desperate to grab something from Sunday’s football match. The Rossoblu are likely to leave their hearts on the field, but seeing that they failed to win previous six league fixtures, we are not tempted to put our money on Ivan Juric’s troops. La Samp, on the other hand, suffered a loss in each of their previous three league games, but that counts nothing when the derby day comes. Both sides are likely to go for a win in the Derby della Lanterna and we believe that there is a big value in betting on both teams to score in what of the biggest derbies in Italy.

High-flying Atalanta will be looking to extend their winning run in the Serie A to five games when they take on Empoli at Stadio Carlo Castellani on Sunday afternoon. The Orobici made a very slow start to the season, but, as expected, they managed to get back on course. Gian Piero Gasperini’s troops have been scoring goals for fun of late and seeing that a win over Empoli will see them climb to the Europa League berth in the Serie A standings, we predict that the visitors will go all guns blazing at the Azzurri on Matchday 13. Empoli desperately needed a win against Udinese and they managed to get one, with the team putting an end to their ten-match winless run in the Italian top flight. However, given Atalanta’s thrilling form, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the visitors.

Parma will be looking to build on a stunning 2-1 win over Torino when they host Sassuolo at their Stadio Ennio Tardini on Matchday 13. The Gli Emiliani have been climbing the standings week by week and they are now 8 points clear of the relegation zone in the Serie A standings. The newcomers must be high on confidence ahead of Sunday’s football game against Sassuolo and we predict that they are going to give fans yet another reason for celebration. Pacey Ivory Coast international Gervinho, who scored his fourth goal of the season against Torino, will be the man to watch in the home team. The Neroverdi, on the other hand, did well to hold Lazio to a 1-1 draw in their last league fixture, but seeing that Parma have been producing thrilling displays of late, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts.

Despite the fact that Napoli faced Genoa at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris on a waterlogged pitch, the Partenopei did well to come from behind and beat the Rossoblu on Matchday 12. It is more than obvious that the Neapolitans are determined to put an end to Juve’s dominance in the Serie A and we predict that Carlo Ancelotti’s troops are going to leave their hearts on the field in Sunday’s football match against Chievo. The Mussi Volanti, on the other hand, are stuck at the bottom of the Serie A standings, meaning that new coach Domenico Di Carlo face an uphill task in the remainder of the season. It is well known that Napoli have turned their Stadio San Paolo into a real fortress and we are positive that they are going to beat the relegation strugglers in front of home fans.

There will be fireworks when Lazio and Milan face each other at Stadio Olimpico on Sunday evening. The Biancocelesti dropped two points in a 1-1 draw with Sassuolo in their last league match, but it is well known that they produce much better showings at home than on the travels. The capital club aim to cement their place in top four, but Sunday’s football match against Milan will be anything but a walk in the park for the hosts. A man to watch in the home side will be Italian attacker Ciro Immobile, who played for the Azzurri in a goalless draw with Portugal at the weekend. The Rossoneri, on the other hand, suffered a heart-breaking 2-0 loss to Juventus in the Serie A derby, but it has to be noted that Gonzalo Higuain missed a penalty in the first half of the match. Genaro Gattuso’s men head into the Serie A derby with the lack of confidence, which is the main reason why home win should be considered.

Cagliari play host to Torino at their Sardegna Arena in the closing match of day 13. The Rossoblu have been producing fine performances of late and it seems as if their displays are better than their results. The Sardinians occupy 13th position in the standings ahead of Monday’s football game and they are five points clear of the relegation zone. Cagliari are eyeing their third consecutive win at home and seeing that their rivals Torino experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 2-1 home loss to Parma, we are tempted to put our money on the hosts. The 2018/2019 season has been a mixed bag for Il Toro so far, therefore, we predict that they are going to return home empty-handed from the trip to Sardinia. However, you should bear in mind that Torino emerged triumphant in each of their previous four meetings in the Italian elite division.

As expected, SPAL were beaten by Juventus at Allianz Stadium on day 13 of the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign and, as a result, they remained in the danger zone in the standings. The Gli Spallini extended their winless run in the Italian top flight to four games and seeing that Empoli head into Saturday’s football match following back-to-back victories over Udinese and Atalanta, home win should not be considered. The Azzurri showed character in the come-from-behind victory over the Orobici and we predict that they are going to give fans yet another reason for celebration on Saturday afternoon. You should bear in mind, though, that Empoli are eyeing their first away win of the season. The Azzurri recorded their last win on the road in the Italian top flight back in April, 2017 against Milan at Stadio San Siro.

Stadio Artemio Franchi will host Saturday’s football game between Fiorentina and Juventus, the two teams who have different ambitions in the 2018/2019 season. The Viola aim to book their place in European competitions whilst the Bianconeri are determined to defend their Scudetto. Fiorentina do not seem to be on top of their game at the moment and it has to be noted that they failed to win previous six league fixtures. Max Allegri’s men, on the other hand, are leading the chase for the Serie A trophy and thanks to a 2-0 win over SPAL they extended their winning run in the Italian top flight to four games. Cristiano Ronaldo has found his goal-scoring touch of late and we predict that the Portuguese superstar is going to lead Juve to yet another victory in the Italian elite division on Saturday evening.

After playing out a 1-1 draw with Genoa in Derby della Lanterna, Sampdoria will be looking to put an end to their five-game winless run in the Serie A when they host Bologna at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. La Samp have been playing below expectations in the 2018/2019 season, but a win over Bologna could be the turning point for the hosts. As always, a man to watch in the home team will be experienced attacker Fabio Quagliarella, who is likely to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, failed to win previous six league fixtures and we do not believe that they are capable of grabbing something from Saturday’s football game. In their last meeting in Genoa Sampdoria recorded a hard-fought 1-0 win over Bologna and we believe that the history is going to repeat itself.

Lazio were on the verge of suffering a loss to Milan at their Stadio Olimpico at the weekend, but former Sevilla winger Correa eventually scored a late equalizer and helped the Biancocelesti grab something from the match. The capital club remained in top four in the Serie A standings and they will be looking to stay in the Champions League berth with a victory over Chievo in Verona. As always, a man to watch in the away team will be experienced attacker Ciro Immobile, who is likely to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. The Mussi Volanti, on the other hand, did well to hold Napoli at Stadio San Paolo to a goalless draw on Domenico Di Carlo’s debut with the club. The rock-bottom side are likely to stick to their defensive style of play against Lazio, but we do not believe that they are capable of claiming yet another major scalp in the Italian top flight.

Milan were more than unfortunate not to beat Lazio at Stadio Olimpico at the weekend, with the team conceding a goal in the dying seconds of the match. The Rossoneri shared the spoils with the Biancocelesti in the “Eternal City” and they will be looking to return to winning ways in the Italian top flight when they host Parma at their Stadio San Siro. Genaro Gattuso’s men aim to regain their spot in top 4 and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at the newcomers. Parma have been playing above expectations in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign, with the team sitting in sixth place in the standings after 13 rounds. Roberto D’Aversa is doing a great job with the Ennio Tardini club and Ivory Coast international Gervinho looks unstoppable at the moment. Seeing that Parma defeated Torino and Sassuolo in previous two league fixtures, we believe that they are going to hold Milan to a draw at Stadio San Siro.

MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore will host Sunday’s football game between Sassuolo and Udinese, the two teams who registered opposite results at the weekend. Sassuolo suffered a shocking 2-1 loss to Parma at Ennio Tardini, whereas Udinese did well to beat Roma in front of home fans. The Neroverdi failed to win previous three home games in the Italian top flight, therefore, home win should not be considered. The Zebrette must be high on confidence following the triumph over the Giallorossi and we predict that they are going to hold Sassuolo to a draw in Reggio nell’ Emilia. In their last meeting at MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore Udinese recorded a hard-fought 1-0 win over Sassuolo and seeing that under 2.5 goals have been netted in six of their last eight meetings in the Italian elite division, a low-scoring affair is on the horizon.

All eyes will be on Stadio Olimpico when Inter and Roma face each other in the Serie A derby on Matchday 14. The Romans did well to roll over Sampdoria in their last home game in the Serie A, but they suffered a shocking 1-0 loss to Udinese at Dacia Arena at the weekend. The Giallorossi dropped to seventh place in the standings and it has to be noted that they are one point behind newcomers Parma in the Serie A table. Inter, on the other hand, recorded a routine 3-0 win over Frosinone at the weekend, with the team melting Napoli’s advantage in the standings to only one point. The Nerazzurri quickly bounced back from a heavy 4-1 loss to Atalanta and seeing that they regained a much-needed confidence, we predict that they are going to spoil Roma’s party at Stadio Olimpico on Sunday evening.

Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino will host Sunday’s football game between Torino and Genoa, the two sides who are almost level on points in the Serie A standings. Torino suffered a shocking 2-1 loss to Parma in their last home game in the national championship and, no doubt, they are eager to give fans some cheer. Il Toro are determined to move a little closer to the Europa League berth and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at Genoa on Matchday 14. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, played out a 1-1 draw with Sampdoria in the local derby at the weekend, but it has to be noted that they failed to win previous seven league fixtures. It is well known that Genoa struggle on the travels, therefore, we predict that they are going to return home empty-handed from the trip to Turin.

Frosinone will be aiming to bounce back from a 3-0 loss to Inter when they host Cagliari at their Stadio Benito Stirpe on Sunday afternoon. The Canarini are still sitting in the relegation zone in the Serie A standings, but Sunday’s football match against Cagliari could be the turning point for them. You should have in mind that Frosinone are after their first home win of the season. The Sardinians, on the other hand, continue with their habit of producing much better performances at home than on the travels. The Rossoblu have recorded only one win on the road this season, which is the main reason why away win should not be considered. A close encounter is on the cards at Stadio Benito Stirpe and we predict that the two teams are going to share the spoils on Matchday 14 in their first ever meeting in the Italian top flight.

Atalanta and Napoli face each other at Stadio Atleti Azzurri in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of the weekend. The Orobici dropped a two-goal advantage against Empoli, with the team eventually suffering a 3-2 loss to the Azzurri. Atalanta, though, did well to beat Inter 4-1 in their last home game in the Italian top flight, which is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of Monday’s football game. Napoli, on the other hand, dropped two points in a goalless draw with rock-bottom Chievo at the weekend, meaning that they are desperate to return to winning ways. The last season’s runners-up are likely to adopt an attack-minded approach in Monday’s clash in Bergamo, meaning that both teams to score bet should be considered. In two of their last three meetings in all competitions both teams found the net.

After 14 rounds played, Juventus are still the only unbeaten side in Serie A. With 13 wins and one draw and a total of 40 points, they are 11 points away from Napoli and Inter Milan, their nearest followers, although Napoli is a game behind as they play away to Atalanta on Monday. The only defeat Juventus suffered in their last ten matches was in November, when they fell 2:1 to Manchester United at home in the Champions league. And they have really been strong defensively, conceding just six goals in that period, two of which were against United. Inter Milan haven’t started the season that well, playing with mixed results but have picked their game up. In the last ten games, they only lost three times, two times in the Champions League and only once in the Scudetto, a surprising 4:1 home defeat to Atalanta in the second week of November. It should be a real thriller on Friday night at the Juventus Stadium.

Roma in seventh place are just four points above Cagliari in 13th place, who are hosting the Romans hoping to win and go just one point behind them. The venue for this late afternoon kick-off will be the Sardegna Arena in Cagliari. Neither team is on a particularly good run of form. Cagliari have lost only once in the last six matches but have also produced one win in that period and against Chievo in late October. They’ve played out four draws and three of them were in their last three Serie A encounters, against SPAL, Torino and Frosinone. Roma have won twice in the last six matches but are without success in the last three games. They’ve been beaten by Udinese away and drawn against Inter Milan at home in the league and were also defeated by Real Madrid in the Champions League. Cagliari obviously have the advantage at home since they are yet to lose here this year.

In the third and last game on Saturday, Sampdoria are travelling to the Olimpico in Rome to take on the home side Lazio. Lazio are on a little four game without a win slide now, confirmed by the surprising draw with struggling Chievo in the last round. However, they’ve been in relatively good form since they have only lost once in Serie A in the last seven encounters. In the last ten games in all competitions they only have two defeats, the other one coming from Apollon Limassol in the Europa League. And they’ve been solid at home with six wins out of last eight. Sampdoria have just one win away from home in the last five. They have been on a little skid in the last five games, but they managed to thrash Bologna 4:1 at home in the last round. And it might have happened in just the right time, when Lazio are struggling to find points giving their opponents on Saturday to get something out of this game.

After 14 rounds played, Juventus are still the only unbeaten side in Serie A. With 13 wins and one draw and a total of 40 points, they are 11 points away from Napoli and Inter Milan, their nearest followers, although Napoli is a game behind as they play away to Atalanta on Monday. The only defeat Juventus suffered in their last ten matches was in November, when they fell 2:1 to Manchester United at home in the Champions league. And they have really been strong defensively, conceding just six goals in that period, two of which were against United. Inter Milan haven’t started the season that well, playing with mixed results but have picked their game up. In the last ten games, they only lost three times, two times in the Champions League and only once in the Scudetto, a surprising 4:1 home defeat to Atalanta in the second week of November. It should be a real thriller on Friday night at the Juventus Stadium.

Bologna have not had a good run in the last six matches. They’ve drawn four games, lost two and conceded 12 goals, which is two a game. In their last match they were beaten heavily by Sampdoria. Now they are travelling to the Carlo Castellani Stadium in Empoli to take on the home team which is unbeaten in the last three matches. They won against Udinese and Atalanta and have drawn against SPAL in the last round. Before this mini run their form was sketchy to say the least, but with these seven points they have now moved out of the danger zone and above the relegation line, two points above their opponents on Sunday. This is basically a six-point game as a win against Bologna will see them move further away from the bottom. Bologna will hope they could create an upset and win, even thought they haven’t won away from home this year, managing to get only three points out of the away matches.

For a while there, after taking the lead against Lazio, Chievo believed they could get their first win this year but then the Romans equalized. Still, the team from Verona have managed to go from -1 points to plus two in the last three games with three successive draws, against Bologna, Napoli and Lazio. They will see that as a good run compared to the rest of the season so far. On Sunday, they go to the Ennio Tardini Stadium to take on Parma who have lifted themselves up to ninth place with two wins and a draw in the last four matches. They are now equal on points with Roma in Sassuolo in 7th and 8th. And they have been playing well in front of the home crowd, losing only once in six matches. Apart from their defeat to AC Milan in the last round, they’ve been improving and are likely to continue which doesn’t spell good news for Chievo in their struggle to move off the bottom of the table.

The Dacia Arena in Udine will host this round 15 encounter between the home side Udinese and the visiting Atalanta. Udinese have managed to triumph against Roma in the last game of November after seven matches without a win in Serie A. They won 1:0. And straight after, they played out a goalless draw with Sassuolo which means they now haven’t conceded a goal in two games. Earning just five points out of the last six games, they now sit in the 16th spot in the table. On the other hand, Atalanta have been beaten away at Empoli after a run of four consecutive wins, including one against Inter Milan in round 13. This solid run has moved them out of the bottom three into 11th place in the standings, just three points away from Torino in sixth, with a game in hand. And they have scored 14 goals in those four wins. Their 4th best offence in the league might prove too much for Udinese.

Genoa are meeting SPAL at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium in this bottom half of the table encounter between sides in the 14th and 15th place, separated by a single point. Genoa lost to Torino in the last round while SPAL drew with Empoli. The Genoans lost four out the last five games while SPAL lost three out of the last five. SPAL have just one victory in the last ten matches, Genoa have two. Even though both teams have the same goal difference, Genoa are the second worst defensive team in Serie A, sharing that 2nd place with Frosinone with both behind Chievo. But they also scored six more goals than their opponents on Sunday. Genoa started the season well at home, with four straight wins but they are now four games without a win at home. SPAL have lost five out of the last six away matches. A win for either team will mean moving further away from the danger zone.

Sassuolo and Fiorentina are meeting at the Citta del Tricolore in an early Sunday noon kick-off. There is two points in it between them, with Fiorentina in 12th and Sassuolo in eighth place. Their forms in the last six matches are similar but Sassuolo have managed to secure one win in that period while the Viola haven’t. They have had five consecutive draws before losing 3:0 at home to Juventus in the last round. Four of the draws ended 1:1 while one was a goalless affair. Sassuolo have also had four draws in the last six, two of which were goalless, including the one against Udinese the last time around. It might come down to who’s playing at home as Sassuolo have been beaten only once at home in the last ten matches. Based on this season, we are likely to see a few goals here. They scored 13 and allowed 11 in Serie A at home this year.

The last match of the round is reserved for the clash between the fourth place AC Milan and the sixth place Torino, separated by four points in the table. The venue, of course, will be the legendary San Siro. The team from Milan has been busy in Serie A and the Europa League. In the domestic league they have won four out of the last six matches, including the win against Parma in the last round. Their only loss came at the hands of the still unbeaten Juventus. In Europe, most recently they drew with Real Betis and beat F91 Dudelange. The home form has been solid, with seven wins and two defeats. They are scoring on average two goals a game at the San Siro. Torino have lost just twice in their last ten Serie A matches.
