The Neroverdi played out a 1-1 draw with Genoa on the road in their last league match, with the team retaining their spot in the middle of the table. Sassuolo, though, face an uphill task against the title holders and we do not believe that they are capable of grabbing something from Sunday’s football match against Juve, who are desperate to return to winning ways.

Sunday’s football game at Stadio San Siro pits together Milan and Cagliari, the two teams who have different ambitions in the 2018/2019 Serie A season. The Rossoneri are eyeing a place in the Champions League, whereas the Sardinians are determined to avoid relegation to Serie B. Milan are after their seventh home win of the season, but coach Genaro Gattuso must warn his men against complacency. Cagliari are tough to beat at home, but given their poor away record, we believe that the hosts are going to emerge triumphant in Sunday’s clash. A man to watch in the home side will be January signing Piatek, who has already started to pay off. Taking everything into account, we believe that home win should be considered. When the two teams met at Stadio San Siro last season Milan recorded a 2-1 win over Cagliari and we believe that the history is going to repeat itself.

Atalanta will be aiming to move a little closer to the Champions League berth in the Serie A standings with a win over SPAL at their Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia. The Orobici have been scoring goals for fun in all competitions in 2019 and the fact that they hammered Juventus 3-0 at home ground in the Coppa Italia is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the visit of SPAL. Duvan Zapata looks unstoppable at the moment and we predict that the team’s top scorer is going to prove a handful for the opposition back-line. SPAL, on the other hand, aim to move away from the danger zone in the Serie A standings, but we do not believe that they are capable of claiming a major scalp on Matchday 23. You should bear in mind, though, that Atalanta have yet to defeat SPAL in the Italian elite division.

After recording a historical 1-0 win over Inter at Giuseppe Meazza, Bologna will be looking to escape the relegation zone in the Serie A standings with a victory over Genoa at their Stadio Renato Dall’Ara. New coach Sinisa Mihajlovic undisputedly gave Bologna a confidence boost and seeing that Genoa struggle on the travels, we believe that the hosts are going to pick up all three points from Sunday’s football match. Sinisa Mihajlovic’s troops are eyeing their first home win since September 2018, when they defeated Udinese at their Stadio Renato Dall’Ara. Cesare Prandelli’s charges, on the other hand, have been showing signs of improvement of late, with the team collecting four points from matches against Empoli and Sassuolo. However, seeing that the hosts want this win more than the visitors, we predict that Cesare Prandelli’s team will return home empty-handed.

In a Friday evening game, Juventus are opening round 24 of the Scudetto by hosting Frosinone at the Allianz Stadium. The Old Lady is the only unbeaten team left in the top European leagues after Paris St Germain lost for the first time this season a few weeks back. Juve have only lost 6 points this year and are clear at the top of the table by 11 points. In the last six matches they have four wins and two draws. Only Parma, Atalanta and Genoa have managed to hold them to a draw this season. Atalanta seem to know how to play against them as they managed to kick them out of the Italian Cup at the end of January. Frosinone have won two out of the last three games moving them a couple of points off Bologna in 17th place. But they are still the worst offence in the league and it’s hard to see how they could score against Juventus.

Cagliari will be hosting Parma at the Sardegna Arena on Saturday afternoon. After five games without a win the home side will want to get their first victory of the new year. Parma are three places above Cagliari in the table, in 12th place but with eight points more. Their form is also sliding after three games without a win. Cagliari has won only once at home in the last five games and only three times in the last ten home matches. The last two defeats at home were to Atalanta, in the Coppa Italia and in the league. Parma are unbeaten away from home in the last three matches, winning in Fiorentina and Udine and drawing 3:3 against Juventus in Torino. Over the last ten matches away, they have won five. Parma won 2:0 back in September, in their first match of the season. Cagliari players have struggled to score this year which might prove a problem. We predict a draw.

Two top of the table teams, Atalanta and AC Milan will clash at the Atleti Azzurri d'Italia Stadium on Saturday evening. The team from Milan sits in fourth place while Atalanta is in 5th place, with one less point. The home side is level on points with Roma in 6th and Lazio in 7th place. Both Milan and Atalanta are unbeaten in the last six league matches. Genoa was the last team to beat Atalanta, back in December. Milan was also last defeated in the same round, by Fiorentina. Home form has been an advantage for Atalanta with only one loss in seven matches and three in the last 15 home fixtures. On the other hand, Milan have only been beaten once in the last ten away matches. Six of those ten were draws which means they are hard to beat on their travels. It should be an even match-up and one goal might decide the winner. We predict a narrow home win.

The noon kick-off on Sunday is reserved for the match between SPAL and Fiorentina at the Paolo Mazza. The Viola is 10th in the Scudetto standings while SPAL is ten points behind in 14th place. The visitors haven’t been beaten in the last five matches in the league. However, they have recorded just one victory during that period along with four draws. In the last two rounds, they drew against Udinese and Napoli. They played brilliantly in the Coppa Italia at the end of January when they thrashed Roma 7:1. In the four matches before the goalless draw with Napoli, Fiorentina players scored 15 goals and conceded eight. A draw away from home seems to be their specialty lately. They’ve drawn six out of the last nine away games without losing one. Interestingly, SPAL have drawn their last six home matches. Fiorentina did beat SPAL in their first encounter this season, but this one has a draw written all over it.

Napoli and Torino are playing at the San Paolo, in the last game scheduled for Sunday. Napoli have been second in the table throughout the whole season. Juventus is ever closer to another title which means Napoli will finish second for two years in a row barring any surprises. Carlo Ancelotti’s side has only been beaten three times this season, the last time against Inter in December. Recently, Milan and Fiorentina both managed to hold them to a goalless draw. Both Napoli and Torino crashed out of the Italian Cup in January. Torino got beat by Fiorentina while AC Milan defeated Napoli. Torino will go to Naples confident as they’ve only lost once in the last six matches in the league and that was to Roma. In the last three rounds, they recorded 1:0 victories over Inter and Udinese and a draw against SPAL. We predict a home win.

Inter Milan has struggled to mount any kind of charge towards the top of the table. Winning one of the last four matches certainly won’t cut it. The three defeats were against Torino and Bologna in the league and against Lazio in the Coppa Italia. To make things worse, two of these defeats came at their home ground where they are welcoming Sampdoria in this round. Inter are third in the table while Sampdoria are ninth, ten points behind. Samp have lost their last two matches, 3:0 to Napoli and 1:0 to Frosinone. They have had a tough run of games in the last six matches. Apart from Napoli and Frosinone, they also lost to AC Milan and Juventus. The one draw was against Fiorentina followed by a win over Udinese. Inter has lost only once at home in the league this year. It’s not likely to happen two games in a row.

The last Empoli win in Serie A happened in early December. They will look to get back to winning against Sassuolo at the Carlo Castellani Stadium. The home side earned only two points in the last eight matches and are sitting in 18th place in the table, level on points with fellow strugglers Bologna in 17th place. They are the second worst defence in the league, but they are also the third best offence in the bottom half of the table. At one point they won three games in a row at home but have since won just one point. Their last match was a 2:2 draw with Chievo. Sassuolo lost to leaders Juventus in the last round. Before that loss they went unbeaten for three games, winning 3:0 against Cagliari and drawing against Inter and Genoa. Both those draws were away from home. Juventus defeat aside, looks like Sassuolo form is on the up so they might pick up all three points against Empoli.

After starting the season with negative points, Chievo are nearing the double figures. They even managed to win their last match of 2018, 1:0 against Frosinone. In this round, they are travelling to Udine and the Dacia Arena. Udinese are not doing so well either. In fact, they have the same record as Chievo in the last six matches – One win, one draw and four defeats. Both teams have earned just a point from the last four games. Their offences have scored the same number of goals, but Udinese has got a slightly better defence. Chievo has the worst defence in Serie A this year. The hosts have improved their home form lately and are unbeaten in the last four matches. The visitors have drawn four out of their last six away games. Udinese won their first game this year and will look to make it a sweep. The best Chievo can hope for is a point.

Genoa have the fourth worst defensive record in the league which is probably why they are down in 13th place. They are welcoming Lazio in this round at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium. The team from Rome is seventh in the standings but level on points with Atalanta in 5th and Roma in 6th spot. Genoa players have scored almost as many goals as Lazio this year but have conceded 15 more. Neither team has suffered a defeat in the last three Serie A matches. Genoa beat Empoli 3:1 before drawing with Sassuolo and Bologna. Lazio played out a 1:1 draw with Inter before beating Frosinone and Empoli, both with 1:0 scores. The three defeats Lazio have in the last ten matches have been against Atalanta, Napoli and Juventus, all above them in the table. Coupled with the fact that Genoa has won only once in the last 10 home games, Lazio should be good for three away points.

In the last match-up of the round, Roma is playing Bologna on Monday night at the Olimpico. Both teams have a win, a defeat and two draws in the last four matches. Roma drew with Atalanta and AC Milan and lost 7:1 to Fiorentina in the Cup before beating Chievo 3:0. Bologna drew with SPAL before losing to Frosinone 4:0. Then they beat Inter and got a point against Genoa. In the last ten matches Roma have only lost to Juventus. The other games ended in five victories and four draws. And they are unbeaten at home since the loss to SPAL in October. Bologna have been under new management in the last couple of games and hopefully that will bring good things. Getting four points out of the last two games is a good start if they want to move up the table from 17th. A draw against Roma would bring another important point.

Milan will be aiming to extend their winning run in the Serie A to three games when they host Empoli at their Stadio Giuseppe Meazza on Matchday 25. The Rossoneri have been scoring goals for fun of late and seeing that they outclassed Atalanta 3-1 in Bergamo in their last league fixture, it is no surprise Genaro Gattuso’s men are seen as hot favourites to win Friday’s football match. Milan are eyeing a place in the Champions League and we predict that they will go all guns blazing at Empoli on Friday evening. The Azzurri did remarkably well to beat Sassuolo 3-0 at home in their last league match, but given their poor away record, we believe that the visitors are going to return home empty-handed. A man to watch in the home team will be January signing Piatek, who scored a brace in the 3-1 win over the Orobici.

As expected, Frosinone suffered a 3-0 loss to Juventus in Turin on Matchday 24. The Canarini remained in the relegation zone in the Serie A standings, but they are only five points behind the “safe zone” ahead of Saturday’s football game against Roma. Frosinone have been having their ups and downs in the second half of the season, but, no doubt, they would be happy with one point from the clash against the Giallorossi. The Romans did well to beat Chievo 3-0 in their last away game in the Italian top flight, which is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the trip to Frosinone. The capital club are eyeing a place in the Champions League and seeing that the relegation strugglers failed to score in previous four home games in the national championship, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the Giallorossi.

Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino will host Saturday’s football game between Torino and Atalanta, the two teams who are eyeing a place in European competitions. Atalanta aim to bounce back from a 3-1 loss to Milan and a win over Torino should see them climb to the Europa League berth in the Serie A standings. The Orobici are likely to stick to their attacking style of play, but beating Il Toro on the road is easier said than done. Torino, on the other hand, are after their third consecutive win in front of home fans and they are likely to rely on their solid defence in Saturday’s clash. Anyhow, a close encounter is on the cards and we predict that the two teams are going to share the spoils on Matchday 25, just like they did in their last meeting in the Italian top flight.

After suffering back-to-back defeats to the likes of Juventus and Empoli, Sassuolo will be looking to return to winning ways in the Serie A when they welcome SPAL at their MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore. The Neroverdi have been struggling at the back of late, but they are definitely capable of grabbing something from Sunday’s football match against the relegation strugglers. SPAL, on the other hand, were totally outplayed by Fiorentina in front of home fans at the weekend, but they still have good chances of securing the top flight survival. Taking everything into account, seeing that both Sassuolo and SPAL should be happy with one point from the MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore clash, share of spoils is on the horizon. It has to be noted that in their last meeting in Reggio nell’Emilia the two teams played out a 1-1 draw.

Sampdoria will be aiming to bounce back from a 2-1 loss to Inter when they welcome Cagliari at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris. La Samp are on a three-game losing run in the Serie A, but despite suffering a dip in form, they are sitting in the top half of the standings. Marco Giampaolo’s team are still in the race for a place in European competitions, meaning that Sunday’s football match is of big importance for them. Sampdoria produce much better displays at home than on the travels and given Cagliari’s poor away record, we are tempted to put our money on the hosts. The Rossoblu did well to beat Parma in front of home fans at the weekend, but seeing that they failed to score in previous three away fixtures, we are positive that the Sardinians are going to return home empty-handed from the trip to Genoa.

Sunday’s football game at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara pits together Bologna and Juventus, the two teams with entirely different ambitions in the second half of the season. Bologna aim to secure the Serie A survival, whilst Juventus are eager to defend their trophy. The Rossoblu have been producing fine performances in the Italian top flight ever since Sinisa Mihajlovic took over the reins, but they will have a big fish to fry against the title holders. The Bianconeri head into the match following back-to-back wins over Sassuolo and Frosinone and they will be looking to cement top position in the standings with a victory over Bologna. Cristiano Ronaldo has been scoring goals for fun of late and we predict that the Portuguese superstar is going to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. Anyhow, David faces Goliath in Bologna, therefore, away win should be considered.

Parma and Napoli take on each other at Stadio Ennio Tardini in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Sunday’s program. Parma failed to win previous four league fixtures, but they are on the right track to secure the Serie A survival. The Gli Emiliani have been struggling at the back of late and it is no surprise they are considered big underdogs in the clash against Napoli. The Partenopei aim to stay in the race for Scudetto and we are positive that they are going to adopt an attack-minded approach in Sunday’s showdown. Napoli are more of a team than Napoli and we are positive that Carlo Ancelotti’s troops are going to prove their worth on the field. In the first half of the season the Partenopei outclassed the Gli Emiliani and we believe that the history is going to repeat itself.

After sharing the spoils with Empoli on the road, Chievo suffered back-to-back defeats to the likes of Roma and Udinese in previous two league fixtures. The Mussi Volanti are stuck at the bottom of the Serie A standings ahead of Sunday’s football match and the lack of confidence seems to be the team’s main problem at the moment. Chievo failed to score in previous two league fixtures and seeing that their rivals Genoa proved their worth in a 2-1 win over Lazio, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the visitors. The Rossoblu aim to climb to the top half of the Serie A standings and given Chievo’s poor form, we are tempted to put our money on Cesare Prandelli’s charges. A man to watch in the away team will be Paraguay international Sanabria, who found the net in the 2-1 victory over the Biancocelesti at the weekend.

All eyes will be on Stadio Artemio Franchi when Fiorentina and Inter face each other on Matchday 25. Fiorentina are brimming with confidence following a 4-1 win over SPAL and they are likely to stick to their attacking style of play against Inter. The Viola aim to move a little closer to the Champions League berth and Sunday’s football game is of huge importance for them. Giovanni Simeone came as a substitute and scored in the 4-1 victory over SPAL and he is likely to lead the line for the hosts against the Nerazzurri. Inter recorded a hard-fought 2-1 win over Sampdoria in their last league fixture, but they will have a much bigger fish to fry in Sunday’s clash against Fiorentina. The hosts want this win more than the visitors, therefore, we are tempted to put our money on Stefano Pioli’s men.

This week, the Friday night game is reserved for the encounter between Cagliari and Inter Milan. After 25 rounds played this season, Inter Milan are in third place, a long way off the top, but just two points above local rival AC Milan. Cagliari are down in 14th place, safe from relegation, but five points off Parma in 13th place. The Milan team are unbeaten in three games in the Scudetto, five in all competitions. They beat Rapid Wien in the Europa league to progress to the round of 16. Their last match was an exciting draw against Fiorentina. Cagliari have managed just one victory in their last six matches, the 2:1 win over Parma. In fact, they have won three times in the last 15 games. Their home record is better, with just three defeats in ten games and one was a Cup game. The visitors will have a game on their hands but should edge it.

The other Milan team, AC Milan, are one of six teams who are unbeaten in the league in their last six matches. Early evening on Saturday they will be hosting Sassuolo at the Giuseppe Meazza. The home side is on a little run of three straight wins in the league with wins against Cagliari, Atalanta and Empoli. Only Juventus have managed to beat them in the last ten matches, and that was a close game. Sassuolo haven’t been in good form even though they only lost twice in six games. Cagliari is the only team they beat during that spell. It doesn’t bode well for them that AC Milan has only lost three times at home in the last 15 matches, with two draws. They won ten games, and four out of last five matches. Last time the visitors won away was against Frosinone back in December. Another home win is on the cards for AC Milan.

Empoli are taking on Parma at the Carlo Castellani Stadium in an early afternoon kick-off on Saturday. The hosts are flirting with relegation sitting fourth from the bottom. Parma are 13th, level on points with Genoa in 12th and five points above the club below them. Both teams have won just once in their last six matches in the league. Empoli beat Sassuolo 3:0 in round 24 while Parma defeated Udinese 2:1 back in January. One slip up from Empoli could mean dropping to the bottom three in the table, while Parma are also threatened by Cagliari who beat them in round 24. Empoli’s form at home is varied, with five win, four losses and a draw. Parma, before losing to Cagliari, were on a three-game unbeaten run away from home. Even though the home side is lower in the standings, they have scored more goals than Parma this season. This gives them a chance to take all three points from this game.

The last match on Saturday is the Roman derby between Lazio and Roma at the Olimpico. The visitors in this match, Roma, are on a four-game winning streak in all competitions and unbeaten in eight games in the league. Lazio are without a win in three games in all competitions and with just five wins in 15 league matches. Last week they were taken out of the Europa League by Sevilla. Roma have the advantage over Porto in the Champions League but have allowed an away goal. Right now, the teams are next to each other in the table, but with a six-point gap. However, Lazio does have a game in hand over Roma as their last match against Udinese was postponed. Before playing Roma, Lazio will have a tough midweek Coppa Italia match against AC Milan. Over the years, Roma has been more successful in their head to head encounters, with Lazio winning only three out of the last 15 meetings. This being a derby game, it’s anyone’s guess.

After a win against Cagliari in the last round, Sampdoria is travelling to Ferrara to take on SPAL at the Paolo Mazza Stadium. Sitting in the 15th place in the Serie A table, SPAL will more than likely be fighting for survival this year. Sampdoria, even though they are up in 9th place, their recent form has been sketchy. Before the win in the last round, they lost three matches in a row; to Napoli, Frosinone and Inter. And they aren’t playing so well away from home. Out of the last ten, they’ve only won two matches. However, they were unable to score in only two of those ten matches. That suggests that they always have a chance on their travels. The home form for SPAL comes in waves. After winning two opening home matches, they lost three in a row. But then they drew the next six matches before losing to the visiting Fiorentina. They might hold on for another point in this game too.

In a bottom of the table clash, Udinese are hosting Bologna at the Dacia Arena. Bologna is trying to get themselves out of trouble but have a long way to go. Udinese has, after four games without one, managed to secure a win against Chievo in round 24. They are 16th in the table but a game behind teams in front of them since their game in the last round was postponed. Bologna are still in the bottom three, and three points from safety. The hosts have improved their form at home in the last five games losing only once. They drew against Frosinone and Fiorentina but did beat fellow strugglers Cagliari and Chievo. Bologna won only once away from home this season and that was a surprise win against Inter at the start of February. While Bologna might be capable of getting at least a point in Udine, the home side has a good record against teams around them in the table.

Even though they are down in tenth place, Fiorentina is unbeaten in the last seven games in the league. On Sunday evening they will be playing Atalanta who are 8th in the standings and three points clear. But they have lost the last two games. They were beaten 3:1 by AC Milan and 2:0 by Torino. Before that they had a run of three-games unbeaten, one of which was against Juventus in the Coppa Italia quarter-final. Fiorentina were held in three of their last four games, by Udinese, Napoli and Inter in the last round. The match at the Stadio Atleti Azzuri d’Italia should be an interesting encounter. Atalanta is playing well at home, losing only two matches out of the last ten. However, Fiorentina are yet to be beaten in their last 10 matches away from home. They’ve won five and drew five games. And they scored 11 goals in the last four away fixtures while Atalanta scored nine at home in the last four games. Fiorentina are in good shape to continue their good run.

Early noon Sunday game will be between Torino and Chievo at the Olimpico Grande Stadium. Chievo are of course still sitting at the bottom of the table with a single win and 14 defeats. They did hold Genoa to a goalless draw in the last round though. And there is some hope as half of their total points this season have come in the last seven matches. Apart from the draw with Genoa, they drew with Empoli at the start of February and beat Frosinone in their last match of 2018. Torino, on the other side, are seventh in the table, level on points with Lazio in 6th place and Atalanta in eighth. The home side is unbeaten in the last five league matches. They’ve beaten Inter, Udinese and Atalanta while being held to a goalless draw by SPAL and Napoli. Torino has won three straight at home without conceding a goal giving Chievo a mountain to climb. The hosts should win this encounter comfortably.

Genoa is welcoming Frosinone at the Comunale Luigi Ferraris Stadium early afternoon on Sunday. Genoa are unbeaten in the league in the last five matches, their last defeat coming from AC Milan in January. Since then, they have defeated Empoli and Lazio but were held by Sassuolo, Bologna and Chievo in the last round. They don’t seem to finish games at home as five of the last ten were draws. They lost three times, including the surprise loss in the Cup to a lower league team. Frosinone did manage to win two out of their last three away games both without conceding. Those two wins were their only triumphs in the last four months in the league. They have lost a match more than last placed Chievo and have the worst defence in the Scudetto, allowing 49 goals so far this year. That, coupled with Genoa’s good form of late, should be enough for a home win.

Top of the table clash between Napoli and Juventus will be the last match of this round. The crowd at the San Paolo will hope that their side will be the first team to defeat Juventus this year in the league. While Juventus are untouchable so far, Napoli have only lost three matches in the league, against Sampdoria early on and the two against Milan teams. Both teams are out of the Coppa Italia. Juventus were beaten 2:0 by Atletico Madrid in the Champions League and are in real danger of not reaching the final stages of the competition. Napoli have beaten FC Zürich twice to book their place in the round of 16 in the UEFA Europa League. Head to head, both teams lost their home games last year. In the first game of this season, Juventus won 3:1 in Torino. All eyes will be on this game on Sunday, and Napoli do have a chance to get a win. After all, they are also unbeaten at home this year.

By defeating Napoli in the last round, Juventus are one step closer to defending their title. In this round, they are playing Udinese at the Juventus Stadium on Friday. After a shock loss to Atletico Madrid in the Champions League, the Old Lady has recovered by first beating Bologna away and then second placed Napoli, also away from home. This means that they are still unbeaten in the league and are well on their way to stay unbeaten this season. Udinese are travelling to Torino after finally winning two games in a row, against Chievo and then against Bologna in the last round. Before that, they went five matches without a win. These two wins lifted them up to 15th place in the table. However, they will find it hard to get anything from Juventus as they haven’t scored a single goal away from home in the last five matches, let alone win a game.

Chievo, the bottom placed team in Serie A, is hosting AC Milan, who are fresh off a win against Sassuolo in the last round. The visitors are also on a four-game winning streak which is likely to become five after this meeting. With 12 games to go, Chievo are rooted to the bottom of the table. While there is still a mathematical chance that they could go on a run and survive the drop, it’s looking less and less possible round after round. AC Milan is fighting with Inter Milan and possibly Roma and Lazio over third place. Currently, they are a single point ahead of Inter and four points off Roma and Lazio. Napoli are just eight points ahead of them and there is still a chance for the Milan team to catch and overtake them. Apart from the fight in the Scudetto they can still reach the final of Coppa Italia after holding Lazio at home in the first leg of the semi-finals. We predict a comfortable away win in this match-up.

After 26 rounds this season, Genoa and Parma are locked in at 12th and 13th place in the standings, both with 30 points. Genoa is above because of a better goal difference. Winning this match will mean moving up and away from the opponent, whichever team wins. Both sides had drawn their matches in the last round. Parma earned a point in Empoli after an exciting 3:3 draw. Genoa played a lacklustre goalless draw with Frosinone at home. For Genoa, it’s their second goalless match in a row and a fourth draw in six matches. Parma is now six matches without a win, but they will be encouraged that they scored three goals against Empoli. The hosts seem to have a problem at home as of late. They’ve only scored in one of their last five home encounters. And they are five games without a win at the Ennio Tardini Stadium. Genoa, on the other side, has won just once in their last five home games. Another draw looks like a likely outcome.

Even after they got a new manager, Bologna are still struggling. They are on a run of four games without a win and three straight losses. In this early afternoon kick-off, they are welcoming Cagliari, who are coming off a surprise win against Inter Milan in the last round. With two wins in the last three games, Cagliari has lifted themselves out of trouble for the moment. Bologna are now four points off safety, down in 18th place. This home game is a must win for them. Their form at home is not promising though. Goals have been the main issue. Scoring in only two home matches out of the last eight does not instil confidence with the fans. The last time they won at home was in the Italian Cup in December, and in the league back in September. Still, their opponents have not made much impact away from home, failing to score in the last four away fixtures. In fact, they are on a five-game losing streak on their travels. Bologna might just scrape a narrow win.

Fresh from humiliating Roma in the city derby game, Lazio are travelling to the Artemio Franchi Stadium to take on Fiorentina on Sunday evening. The visitors beat Roma 3:0 and are now three points behind them in the table with a game in hand. Before this win, Lazio had four disappointing matches. They crashed out of the Europa League with two defeats to Sevilla. In between those two meetings they lost to Genoa in Serie A. And then they hosted AC Milan in the Coppa Italia semi-final. The game was a goalless draw so they will have to go through to the final the hard way. Fiorentina has had a nightmare in defence recently allowing three goals in each of the last three games. They drew 3:3 with Inter before finishing the first semi-final leg of the Coppa Italia with Atalanta with the same result. To top it off, they lost 3:1 to Atalanta in the last league match. Might just be the wrong time to play Lazio right now.

Torino is one of the four teams who are unbeaten in the last six matches. They are travelling to Frosinone on Sunday afternoon hoping to continue in the same manner. Torino are 7th in the table, level on points with Lazio in 6th and Atalanta in 8th place. Their defence is doing a great job as of late. The team hasn’t conceded a goal in the last six matches, home or away. However, their away form is interesting. They only won two out of the last ten away games. And they only lost one. In seven games, Torino went home with a point. Four of those seven draws were goalless. Frosinone stopped a two-game losing run with a draw against Genoa in the last round. Goals are still hard to come by. The players fail to score every other game. That’s why this game at home is extra important. A win would take them above Bologna and towards safety, but a point will still be a good result at this point.

In the last round, Cagliari snapped Inters’ winning streak, beating the Milan team 2:1 at their own ground. Looking at that result, SPAL might hope they could achieve the same outcome in this round. The hosts dropped to fourth in the table because of this loss and a draw with Fiorentina in the round before. However, SPAL is now five games without a win and struggling down in 16th place. They will have a chance to get something out of this match as Inter will be tired after a trip to Frankfurt where they are taking on Eintracht in the next round of the Europa League. Inter narrowly beat SPAL in the first match of this season. While revenge by SPAL is possible, they are more likely to get a point out of this match. However, if the hosts get a good result in Germany, they will be on a high.

This year only one team has scored more goals than Atalanta, and that’s Juventus. They have also scored 11 more than their opponents in this round, Sampdoria. The teams are next to each other in the table, with two points separating them. Atalanta is in 8th place, level on points with Lazio and Torino above them. Sampdoria is in 9th place being chased by Fiorentina in 10th place. The hosts have recovered with two wins after three straight losses. In the last two rounds they beat Cagliari 1:0 at home and SPAL 2:1 away. The visitors played Fiorentina in their last two matches. The first one was one of the Coppa Italia semi-finals which finished with a 3:3 draw. And then they defeated them at home in the last round of Serie A. Sampdoria won their first meeting in the league this year. Atalanta has scored 17 goals in the last six away matches so they are in with a chance of getting good result here.

Sassuolo came back from Milan extending their winless streak to five games. Napoli played Juventus at home but were left disappointed after a narrow loss. On Sunday afternoon, Napoli will play Sassuolo at the Citta del Tricolore. The hosts are down in 11th place and in danger of being overtaken by Parma or Genoa should they lose this match. Napoli must bounce back from the defeat and the knowledge that they probably lost any chances of winning the tittle too. Sassuolo might see their chance of getting some points if Napoli are still thinking about the Juventus game come Sunday. The visitors defeated Sassuolo comfortably in their first season meeting. Out of the 12 head to head meetings in their history, the home side won only one back in 2015. The home form of the team from Reggio nell’Emilia is worrying as they have conceded 18 goals in the last ten home matches. Napoli should make an easy job out of this one.

After a tough Roman derby, the Olimpico will host the game between Roma and Empoli. The hosts were looking to continue a four-game winning streak before losing to Lazio in the last round. A win against Empoli would get them back in the hunt for the Champions League place. They are currently in fifth place, four points behind Inter in 4th and a win in front of Lazio who have a game in hand. With just a single win in the last six matched, Empoli are sitting in 17th place, four points above the relegation zone. They will be fighting to stay up since they are hampered by the worse defence in the league. (equal with Chievo in that respect) Saying that, Empoli are the second-best scoring team in the bottom half of the table so there’s always a chance. Empoli have scored six and conceded six goals in the last three games, so we might be in for a high scoring draw in this encounter. However, Roma should just edge it.

Cagliari have been having their ups and downs of late. The Sardinians have been producing fine performances on home soil, while struggling on the travels. The Rossoblu did well to beat Inter in their last home game in the national championship, which is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the visit of Fiorentina. The Viola, on the other hand, are not enjoying a season to remember as they are stuck in the middle of the Serie A standings. Fiorentina have been struggling at the back of late and seeing that Cagliari are a real force to be reckoned with at home, we predict that the visitors are going to return home empty-handed from the trip to Sardinia. You should bear in mind that Cagliari are eyeing their sixth home win of the season in the Italian top flight.

Torino will be looking to extend their winning run in the Serie A to four games when they host Bologna at their Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. Il Toro have been in a splendid form of late and they are obviously determined to book their place in European competitions. The hosts are brimming with confidence ahead of Saturday’s football match and we predict that they are going to give fans yet another reason for celebration this weekend. Bologna are tough to beat at home, but given their poor away record, we do not believe that they are capable of spoiling Torino’s party at Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. A man to watch in the home team will be Andrea Belotti, who scored a brace in the come-from-behind win over Frosinone and we are positive that he is going to pose a big threat for the opposition back-line.

Despite producing a fine display against Napoli at the weekend, Sassuolo eventually played out a draw with the second-placed side. The Neroverdi suffered three defeats in previous five league fixtures, meaning that the lack of confidence could prove to be a big problem for the hosts in Saturday’s football game against Sampdoria. Anyhow, seeing that Sassuolo are tough to beat at home, we predict that they are going to grab something from the MAPEI Stadium – Citta del Tricolore clash. La Samp sit in the middle of the table as well and they will be looking to bounce back from a 2-1 loss to Atalanta when they face the Neroverdi on Matchday 28. The two teams seem to be evenly matched at the moment, therefore we believe that there is a big value in betting on draw. In their last meeting in Genoa the two teams played out a goalless draw.

Stadio Paolo Mazza will host Saturday’s football match between SPAL and Roma, the two teams with entirely different ambitions in the second half of the season. SPAL aim to secure the Serie A survival, whilst Roma are eyeing a place in the Champions League. Both sides are likely to adopt an attack-minded approach in Saturday’s clash, but seeing that the hosts have been totally out of form of late, we are tempted to put our money on the capital club this time out. SPAL suffered four defeats in previous five league fixtures and we do not believe that they are capable of shocking the Giallorossi on Matchday 28. The Romans suffered elimination in the Champions League last 16, meaning that they will be fully focused on the national championship in the remainder of the season. Bosnia international Edin Dzeko is likely to lead the line for the visitors.

All eyes will be on Stadio Giuseppe Meazza when Milan and Inter face each other in the Derby della Madonnina. Milan recorded a very important 2-1 win over rock-bottom Chievo at the weekend and thanks to the triumph they moved one step closer to securing a top-four finish. Genaro Gattuso’s men are eager to book their place in the Champions League and seeing that they are on a five-game winning run in the Italian top flight ahead of the Milan derby, home win should be considered. Inter did well to beat SPAL at home in their last league match, but they will have a much bigger fish to fry in Sunday’s football match. A man to watch in the home team will be January signing Piatek, who scored the winner against the Mussi Volanti at the weekend. Lautaro Martinez, on the other hand, is likely to lead the line for the Nerazzurri.

Atalanta will be looking to build on a 2-1 win at Sampdoria when they host Chievo at their Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia on day 28. The Orobici have been in a fine form in the Serie A of late and it is more than obvious that they are determined to book their place in European competitions. Sunday’s football game against Chievo is of big importance for Atalanta and we predict that the hosts are going to prove their worth on the field. The rock-bottom side head into the match following a 2-1 home loss to Milan and we do not believe that they are capable of spoiling the Orobici’s party at Stadio Atleti Azzurri d’Italia. A man to watch in the home side will be Duvan Zapata, who has netted 17 goals so far this term and who is enjoying the best season of his career.

After sharing the spoils with Fiorentina at Stadio Artemio Franchi, Lazio will be looking to return to winning ways in the Serie A when they host Parma at their Stadio Olimpico. The Biancocelesti still hope they could grab a place in the Champions League and we predict that they will fight tooth and nail against Parma on Matchday 28. Ciro Immobile, who found the net in the 1-1 draw with the Viola at the weekend, will be the man to watch in the home team and we believe that he is going to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. Parma, on the other hand, are on the right track to secure the Serie A survival, which is the team’s main goal for the 2018/2019 season. Anyhow, the hosts want this win more than the visitors and we predict that Simone Inzaghi’s men are going to prove their worth on the field.

Empoli and Frosinone face each other at Stadio Carlo Castellani in the relegation six-pointer. Empoli are eager to move away from the danger zone, but Sunday’s football game against Frosinone will be anything but a walk in the park for the hosts. The Azzurri scored six goals in total in previous two home fixtures in the Serie A, which is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the visit of Frosinone. The Canarini, on the other hand, sit in the relegation zone and they are on a four-game winless run in the Italian elite division. Frosinone have been struggling on the travels in the 2018/2019 season and seeing that Empoli have been producing fine performances at home ground of late, we predict that the visitors are going to return home empty-handed. In the first half of the season the two teams played out a thrilling 3-3 draw.

Despite the fact that Max Allegri rested a number of first-team regulars against Udinese, Juventus did well to crush the Zebrette 4-1 in Turin. Juve moved one step closer to defending their trophy and seeing that they are 18 points clear of second-placed Napoli in the Serie A standings, coach Max Allegri is likely to mix the squad against Genoa on Matchday 28. Teenager Moise Kean, who scored a brace against Udinese, is likely to lead the line for the visitors. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, aim to bounce back from a 1-0 loss to Parma and it has to be noted that they failed to find the net in previous three league fixtures. However, seeing that the Bianconeri have almost defended their trophy, we believe that there is a big value in betting on a draw. In the first half of the season the two teams shared the spoils in Turin.

Napoli were on the verge of suffering a loss to Sassuolo at the weekend, but they eventually scored a late equalizer and picked up one point from the match. The Neapolitans are now 18 points behind league leaders Juventus, meaning that they have very slim chances of winning the Scudetto. However, Carlo Ancelotti’s troops have yet to secure second position in the Serie A standings, meaning that they are going to go all guns blazing at Udinese on Matchday 28. The Zebrette failed to make life difficult for Juve in Turin at the weekend and seeing that they have been struggling on the travels in the 2018/2019 Serie A campaign, home win should be considered. In their last meeting at Stadio San Paolo Napoli recorded a 4-2 win over Udinese and we believe that the history is going to repeat itself.

Despite being regarded as big underdogs in their last league game against Atalanta, Chievo did remarkably well to hold the Orobici to a 1-1 draw in Bergamo. Picking up one point from the Atalanta clash, though, is unlikely to help the Mussi Volanti avoid relegation to Serie B, but their pride will surely be at stake in the remainder of the season. Chievo aim to give fans some cheer and we are positive that the rock-bottom side will leave their hearts on the field in Friday’s football match against Cagliari. The Sardinians, on the other hand, want to escape the danger zone, but seeing that Chievo produced a fine display in the draw with the Orobici, we believe that the hosts are going to grab something from the match. You should bear in mind that Cagliari are on a six-game losing run on the road in the Italian top flight.

Sampdoria will be looking to build on a 5-3 win over Sassuolo when they welcome Milan at their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris this weekend. La Samp impressed in the triumph over the Neroverdi, with veteran Fabio Quagliarella scoring his 21st goal of the season. The experienced attacker looks unstoppable and he is likely to prove a handful for the opposition defenders. It is well known that over the years Sampdoria have turned their stadium into a real fortress, therefore, we are positive that they are going to grab something from Saturday’s football game. The Rossoneri, on the other hand, suffered a heart-breaking 3-2 loss to their local rivals Milan before the international break and, no doubt, they would be happy with one point from the Sampdoria clash. Seeing that a close encounter is on the cards, we believe that there is a big value in betting on draw.

Juventus are on the right track to defend their Scudetto and, as a result, coach Max Allegri mixed the squad against Genoa on Matchday 28. The Bianconeri suffered an unexpected 2-0 loss to the Rossoblu at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris and, no doubt, they are eager to get back on course. Juve play host to Empoli in their first game following the international break and we predict that they are going to adopt an attack-minded approach in Saturday’s football match. Max Allegri is likely to stick to his rotation policy, but regardless of which players will be deployed up front, we believe that there is a big value in betting on the hosts. The Azzurri, on the other hand, desperately needed a win against Frosinone and they managed to get one. Empoli are eager to secure the Serie A survival, but they face an uphill task in the game against the title holders.

After suffering back-to-back losses to the likes of Juventus and Napoli, Udinese will be aiming to move away from the danger zone with a win over Genoa. Udinese were totally outplayed by both Juventus and Napoli on the road, but they are tough to beat at home. The Zebrette are eager to secure yet another Serie A survival and seeing that Genoa are safe for now, home win should be considered. The Rossoblu, on the other hand, did well to beat Max Allegri’s troops at home on Matchday 28, but you should bear in mind that recorded only one win in previous ten away games in the national championship. The hosts want this win more than the visitors and we predict that they are going to give fans something to cheer about this weekend. In the first half of the season the two teams played out a thrilling 2-2 draw.

All eyes will be on Stadio Giuseppe Meazza when Inter and Lazio face each other on Matchday 29. The Nerazzurri proved their worth in back-to-back wins over SPAL and Milan, with the team moving one step closer to booking their place in the Champions League.
Luciano Spalletti’s troops have been scoring goals for fun of late and it is no surprise they are seen as favourites to win Sunday’s football game. A man to watch in the home team will be Lautaro Martinez, who found the net from the penalty spot in the Milan derby. The Biancocelesti, on the other hand, are eyeing a place in the Champions League as well and they are likely to go for a win in the Stadio Giuseppe Meazza clash. Anyhow, seeing that Inter have found their best form of late, home win should be considered.

Bologna have been making progress ever since Sinisa Mihajlovic took over the reins. The Rossoblu defeated Cagliari in their last home game in the Serie A, with the team shocking Torino in Turin on Matchday 28. Sinisa Mihajlovic’s men are brimming with confidence ahead of the visit of Sassuolo and we predict that they are going to give fans yet another reason for celebration this weekend. The Neroverdi, on the other hand, experienced all sorts of problems at the back in a 5-3 loss to Sampdoria and we do not believe that they are capable of spoiling Bologna’s party at Stadio Renato Dall’Ara. In their last meeting in Bologna the hosts emerged triumphant. It has to be noted, though, that the hosts will be without suspended defender Lyanco, who was sent off against Il Toro.

Parma will be looking to bounce back from a heavy 4-1 loss to Lazio when they host Atalanta at their Stadio Ennio Tardini on Sunday. The newcomers have been playing above expectations in the 2018/2019 Serie A season, but they can’t afford any complacency if they are to secure the top flight survival. A man to watch in the home team will be pacey Ivory Coast international Gervinho. Atalanta, on the other hand, dropped two points in a 1-1 draw with rock-bottom Chievo in Bergamo and, no doubt, they are determined to return to winning ways. The Orobici are likely to go all guns blazing at Parma and seeing that they want this win more than the mid-table side, away win should be considered. Duvan Zapata, who has netted 17 goals in the Serie A so far this season, is likely to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders.

Stadio Olimpico will host Sunday’s football game between Roma and Napoli, the two teams who are eyeing a place in the Champions League. Roma suffered a shocking 2-1 loss to SPAL in their last league match and, as a result, they are now four points behind fourth-placed Milan in the standings. The Giallorossi produce much better showings at home than on the travels and it has to be noted that they recorded five wins in previous six home fixtures in the national championship. Edin Dzeko is likely to lead the line for the hosts and we are positive that the Romans are going to find the net in the Serie A derby. The Neapolitans have slim chances of winning Scudetto, but they are on the right track to finish the season in second place in the standings. Carlo Ancelotti’s men are likely to stick to their attacking style of play, therefore, both teams to score bet should be considered.

Frosinone will be looking to make amends for back-to-back losses to the likes of Torino and Empoli when they host SPAL at their Stadio Benito Stirpe in what could be the crucial game in their battle for survival. The Canarini have no other choice but to go all guns blazing at SPAL, but seeing that the visitors are only two points clear of the relegation zone, this game will be anything but a walk in the park for the hosts. Leonardo Semplici’s troops proved their worth in a 2-1 win over Roma in front of home fans, but seeing that they are not regarded as good travelers, we predict that they are going to share the spoils with Frosinone on Matchday 29. You should bear in mind, though, that the Canarini emerged triumphant in each of their previous three meetings with the Gli Spallini.

Fiorentina and Torino take on each other at Stadio Artemio Franchi in what is expected to be one of the most entertaining games of Sunday’s program. Fiorentina are on a four-game winless run in the Serie A and they have slim chances of booking their place in European competitions. The Viola have been struggling at the back of late and we do not believe that there is a big value in betting on the home side. Il Toro, on the other hand, suffered a 3-2 loss to Bologna on Matcday 28, meaning that they are eager to get back on course. Walter Mazzarri is doing a good job with Torino and we predict that they are going to take advantage of the fact that Fiorentina suffered a dip in form. The Viola eliminated the Toro in the Italian Cup earlier in 2019, meaning that the visitors are hungry for revenge.

After two straight losses, AC Milan are looking to get back on the winning streak against Udinese who are sitting in the bottom half of the table. Before losing to Inter and Sampdoria in the last two rounds, Milan has gone ten games unbeaten. Udinese has beaten Genoa in the last round after losing heavily to both Juventus and Napoli in the two rounds before, conceding eight goals in the process. 

With nine matches to go until the end of the season, the battle for the Champions League place is heating up and Milan is being chased by two teams, as well as fighting with Inter who are two points above them in the table. Udinese are just three points above the relegation zone and have a big fight ahead to stay up. Their main contenders are SPAL, Bologna and Empoli. Milan are definitely favorite for a comfortable home win.

Cagliari are set to welcome Serie A leaders at the Sardegna Stadium on Tuesday evening. They are going into this game after two back-to-back wins and three in the last four games. They’ve successfully dispatched with Inter, Sampdoria and Chievo in the last round. But, even with Ronaldo out through injury, Juventus are travelling to Cagliari with an 18-point lead in the scudetto and feeling confident. 

Their loss to Genoa in the round before last was just a blip in an otherwise perfect season. The Old Lady has also made it to the Champions League quarter-finals once again where they will battle the surprise package Ajax for a place in the semi-finals. The home team is in the middle of the table, practically safe but only eight points from the relegation zone. Another win would consolidate their position in the standings. This will be their best chance to beat Juventus, so a draw is a minimum they should hope for.

The Serie A season is not over yet, but at the end of it, Genoa might just be the only team to have beaten Juventus on their way to another Scudetto. But, after performing that feat, they fell to Udinese in the last round, losing any chance to fight for a spot leading to European football next year. On Wednesday, they are taking on Inter Milan at the Luigi Ferraris Stadium. Their forms have been similar in recent matches. 

Genoa has won two, lost two and drawn two matches. Inter has won two but lost three and drawn one. They’ve also crashed out of the Europa League, losing to Frankfurt 1:0 on aggregate. They did win the Milan derby, but lost to Lazio in the last round. The only loss Genoa suffered at home in the last ten matches was against the other Milan team. The visitors haven’t been convincing on their travels with four wins in 12 games. Genoa have a good chance to win but Inter might go away with a point.

Third from the bottom, Empoli is a win away from getting out of the relegation zone but will have a tough match ahead. They are playing second-placed Napoli at the Carlo Castellani Stadium. They’ve given Juventus a hard time in the last round so anything is possible. However, after two games without a win, Napoli has come back strong, beating Udinese and Roma and scoring four goals in both encounters. 

They need a couple of more wins to secure their second place in the Scudetto for the second season in a row. While Empoli are good at home against teams lower in the standings, they haven’t played well against the top six teams. And Napoli has scored nine goals in the last three away games in the league. They did lose to Salzburg in the Europa League but went through on aggregate and will play Arsenal in the next round. Napoli should win this match but narrowly.

Even though they’ve been triumphant in the last two matches, against Roma and Frosinone, SPAL has a tough match ahead with Lazio coming to town. The team from Rome is fifth in the table, and only a win away from a Champions League placement. And they are a game behind fourth placed AC Milan. Furthermore, they have beaten Roma and Inter, and drawn against AC Milan in the last month. 

However, Lazio did crash out of the Europa League. SPAL succeeded in moving away from the relegation zone with two wins in a row, but they will need at least to more to be safe from going down. A point against an in-form Lazio team would be another step towards safety. Being the third worst scoring team in the league does not bode well for them. But the visitors haven’t been prolific either on their travels managing less than a goal per game.

One of the teams who will most certainly be playing in Serie B next season, Frosinone, is welcoming Parma at the Benito Stirpe Stadium. The visitors are in the middle of the standings, level on points with Genoa and Cagliari, eight points from the relegation zone and 16 points away from the hosts. Frosinone have won any of their last six matches, managing only one goalless draw with Genoa during that time. 

Things are not looking optimistic. They are eight points behind Empoli and ten points behind Bologna. Parma will want to bounce back after two straight losses and four in the last six games. However, they were held by Frosinone in their first encounter of the season, in Parma. If they can repeat that, a point for the struggling side might have a positive effect on them. An away win is more likely though but by the smallest of margins.

Fiorentina will try to snap their six-game winless streak against Roma at the Olimpico on Wednesday. After beating SPAL comfortably back in February, the Viola has lost two and drawn four matches. They did however score in each of those matches, ten in total. This spate of bad results and four points out of possible 15 has left them without a chance of fighting for a top six spot. 

Half of the matches they played this season has ended in a draw; that’s more than any other team in the league. Roma has been inconsistent but managed to stay in contention for one of the European places next year. With three wins and three defeats in the last six games, they are just a point away from Lazio and Atalanta in fifth and sixth place. Even the Champions League is still an option as they are six points away from Inter in third. They are due a win and it might just come against struggling Fiorentina.

Closing out the Wednesday schedule, Torino are playing hosts to Sampdoria at the Olimpico. The two teams are level on points in the table, with Samp having a better goal difference by a single goal. They won four out of their last five matches looking to challenge Lazio and Atalanta who are fifth and sixth. Every point going forward takes them closer to that goal. But Torino have the same aspirations. 

After winning three games in a row, they lost to Bologna and Fiorentina in the last two rounds. Recently, they have been playing well at home, with four straight wins and clean sheets before the loss to Bologna, who are fighting for survival. Sampdoria has only won three of their last ten away games but, scoring 20 goals in that time. They won the last two, scoring seven goals. The home side will find it hard to keep a clean sheet in this match and will need to be on their scoring best.

If they carry on like this, Sassuolo will find themselves in the relegation fight by the end of the season. But, after eight games without a win, they are welcoming Chievo at the Citta del Tricolore. Chievo are dead last in the table. They would have to win seven out of the last nine matches in the season to have a chance of staying up. Seeing as they only managed one win so far, that scenario is not likely to happen, and they will most certainly be relegated. 

They are the worst scoring and the worst defensive team. Sassuolo have went from a good defensive team to conceding 16 goals in the last six matches, almost three a game. However, a game against Chievo is a perfect fixture for them to snap their losing streak. A win for the home team will see them back in the middle of the table and safe to fight another season in the Scudetto.

With a mini run of three-games unbeaten, Bologna has pulled themselves out of the relegation zone. They are now a point behind Udinese and two behind SPAL. Atalanta is their next opponent, and they will be a tough challenge at the Atleti Azzuri d’Italia. The home side is four-games unbeaten and in sixth place in the table, level on points with Lazio in fifth place. If we count the Italian Cup, they are five-games unbeaten. 

Atalanta is aiming to fight for the Champions League place while Bologna is fighting for survival. At home they’ve lost only four matches out of the last fifteen, one in the last five games. They have even thrown Juventus out of the Cup. Bologna must pull another rabbit out of the hat to continue their good run. Good news is they scored seven goals in the last three wins. Bad news is they allowed three. A point for the visitors wouldn’t be the worst thing.

Sampdoria and Roma face each other at Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris in what is expected to be one of the most interesting games of Saturday’s program. Both sides are eyeing a place in European competitions and there is every chance we will see a lively contest in Genoa. It is well known that La Samp are tough to beat at home and the fact that they defeated Milan in their last home fixture in the national championship is surely giving fans a reason for optimism ahead of the visit of Roma. 

The Romans, on the other hand, are not having a season to remember, but they are still in the race for a place in European competitions. Anyhow, considering that Fabio Quagliarella and Co. have turned their Stadio Comunale Luigi Ferraris into a real fortress, away win should not be considered and we are tempted to put our money on draw.

There will be fireworks when Juventus and Milan face each other at Allianz Stadium in the Serie A derby. Thanks to a 2-0 win at Cagliari Juve moved one step closer to defending the Scudetto and seeing that they will be with one eye on the Champions League game against Ajax, we are positive that coach Max Allegri is likely to mix the squad against the Rossoneri. 

Milan, on the other hand, are eyeing a place in the Champions League and we are positive that they are going to fight tooth and nail against the Bianconeri. Cristiano Ronaldo is unlikely to be risked against Milan and, in his absence, Paulo Dybala is likely to pose a big threat for the opposition defenders. Anyhow, given the importance of the match for Genaro Gattuso’s troops, we are positive that the visitors are going to grab something from the Serie A derby.

Parma will be aiming to put an end to their three-match losing run in the Serie A when they host Torino at Stadio Ennio Tardini on Matchday 30. Roberto D’Aversa’s troops have been struggling at the back of late and, as a result, their Serie A status is now in danger. Parma are desperate to grab something from Saturday’s football game and we are positive that they are going to leave their hearts on the field. 

The newcomers are only six points clear of the relegation zone, meaning that this game could be crucial for them in the battle for survival.
